jobs.title: Junior Software Engineer
Freelance Front End Developer
Full Stack Web Developer Big Data Machine Learning
jobs.content: SiteZeus is a fast-growing startup disrupting the way growing companies select new locations with Predictive Analytics based on big data and machine learning.  We are seeking the best & brightest engineers to join our Product Development team to enhance our award-winning product suite.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content:
What You'll Do/Need:


Unlike some technology teams, we share our focus with the business side of our company. If you want to use technology to solve business problems, we want to talk to you.


Responsibilities



  • Collaborate with other Engineers, Developers, Architects, QA team members, System Engineers and Product Managers to solve technical issues

  • Understand requirements, implement designs and provide administration tools and documentation for specific projects

  • Develop in a C# environment while working on web applications, WPF, WCF and web services

  • Participate in design and code reviews

  • Follow and enhance existing development processes

  • Measure and verify that code has acceptable performance and scalability

jobs.title: Freelance Graphic Designer
jobs.content:
Sydell Group, a creator and manager of unique hotels, is looking for a freelance graphic designer to aid in creating and producing creative collateral for its diverse group of properties.

Candidate will work with the creative department to produce a variety of materials, including marketing collateral, sales and ad collateral, and guest materials, using brand guides and design standards from each property.

We're seeking New York-based candidates only. Ideally, the designer will be able to work in Sydell’s office in New York three days per week, but we are open to flexible work arrangements. Candidate should be fluent in InDesign, Acrobat, Illustrator and Photoshop. Digital, social media and video experience a plus.

Please respond with your availability and expected compensation.

jobs.title: Interactive News Developer
jobs.content:
The Interactive News desk at The New York Times is looking for creative, interdisciplinary thinkers with strong technical backgrounds.

About Us

Interactive News is the special digital projects team embedded within the newsroom of The New York Times. You‚Äôll be working with editors, reporters, photographers, designers and other developers to create newsroom-facing tools and reader-facing projects that expand the horizons of our digital news report.

Our department‚Äôs goal is to practice web development and software engineering as a newsroom craft. We draw on technical expertise to imagine new editorial forms. Most of our work is published in collaboration with other newsroom departments. Your role is to bring digital creativity and software expertise. Interactive News handles a mix of project types:

Early-stage experiments: You will iterate quickly and collaboratively to explore new ideas. More mature projects: You will use engineering expertise to improve the scale and repeatability of our projects. Library and tool development: You will package functionality so that it can be reused by others in the organization. About You

No journalism experience is required, but you should enjoy thinking about how to create thoughtful experiences for our readers.

You also have a strong sense of personal responsibility: You can be trusted to deliver. You take a creative approach to solving problems. You have a strong technical skillset: You can take ownership of a high-quality digital experience from start to finish. You enjoy working as part of a team but are self-disciplined when working alone. You‚Äôre comfortable jumping between details and bigger-picture challenges. If you are a member of a group that has been historically underrepresented in technology, we especially encourage you to apply. About our Tech

Ruby, Node and Python are the team‚Äôs predominant backend technologies. On the frontend, our projects are largely JavaScript (ES5+) and CSS (often SASS), with judicious use of ReactJS and similar project-appropriate libraries. Deployment, testing and maintenance of projects are shared responsibilities. We currently deploy server-side code in Docker containers to a Kubernetes cluster. You should have demonstrated experience in one of the areas above and be willing to build skills in the rest. We have both backend-focused and frontend-focused roles available. From either perspective, you ideally would be comfortable working (or eager to learn to work) across the stack. In Interactive News, we want every team member to be comfortable making changes and pushing them live to the site.

Apply!

Please provide:

Links to some work samples, e.g. sites you‚Äôve worked on, your Github, or a portfolio site Your r√©sum√© A brief paragraph describing why you‚Äôre interested in the job and what you hope to get out of it

jobs.title: Rails Developer (Remote)
jobs.content:
TaxJar is the leading technology solution for busy eCommerce sellers to manage sales tax and is trusted by more than 5,000 businesses. We were founded to help eCommerce owners spend less time on sales tax and more time growing the businesses they love. We‚Äôre passionate about creating simple solutions and leveraging technology to solve complicated sales tax issues. We're not just about sales tax though, we're a technology-driven company focused on providing a great experience for both merchants and developers."

We offer TaxJar Reports , a simple web-based reporting tool that organizes sales tax data into return-ready reports by state; AutoFile, a service that automatically files sales tax returns; and SmartCalcs API, a modern, accurate, sales tax API for developers to outsource sales tax rates and calculations. For developers, we have created an helpful API demo environment and also are fanatics about creating and maintaining great API documentation.

We have an immediate opening for a Ruby on Rails Developer who wants to make a difference on a growing, experienced team of entrepreneurs.

This is a full-time remote position, available to folks located in the US.

As a Rails Developer you will:

  • Write excellent Ruby on Rails code daily.
  • Be challenged weekly to solve new problems
  • Review and test your teammates pull requests
  • Create and maintain our existing Rspec test suites
  • Maintain and update our sales tax reporting application
  • Build out apps and services for managing thousands of sales tax rules
  • Help with improving and scaling our SmartCalcs API
  • Work with Rails, Heroku, Postgres, Sidekiq, Magento, WooCommerce, and more.
  • Help monitor and support 24/7 Rails applications and services
  • Ensuring the happiness of our more than 5,000 paying customers is everything to us. Every employee, even the CEO, spends time working the customer success inbox.

Requirements

  • 2+ years Experience with: Rails 4, Postgres, Heroku, AWS, Sidekiq
  • Ability to write clear and accurate tests using RSpec/Capybara
  • Write code that is maintainable and readable by your team
  • Be accountable for the code you deliver to production
  • Manage development tasks from assignment through to production
  • Agile, humble, trustworthy, and a team player
  • Rapid learner who thrives in a fast-paced and demanding environment
  • Passion for building simple and intuitive solutions for complex problems in ecommerce
  • Prior SaaS development, API development or similar app dev experience
  • Excel at communicating with the team remotely (chat, video, email, etc).

You Could Be a JarHead If You're....

  • A pro at communicating
  • Well-experienced working remotely
  • Accountable
  • Never tired of learning
  • A team player. (We adhere to the No Jerk Code. Too much work to be done to deal with egos.)
  • Hungry to play an impactful role

Benefits

All of our employees get the following benefits:

  • Competitive Salary
  • Above market-level equity
  • Work from anywhere (obviously)
  • Health, dental, vision, short-and-long-term disability plans
  • Flexible vacation policy (actually, there is no policy)
  • Company retreats around the country 2x year

jobs.title: Lead Software Engineer
jobs.content:
• Effectively communicate technical concepts to developers and product managers; lead and mentor junior engineers

  • Collaborate with your core team of 5 in developing applications for internal and external clients

  • Develop completely new products and tools that will be shared across the application development landscape at ZEFR

  • Work alongside smart, fun, and driven teams; play basketball, have a snow cone, reign supreme at Pub Trivia Night, battle for your digital life in the War Room, express your creativity in our One Minute Film Festivals, Open Mic Night, or Instagram Challenges, eat cake on Cake Day (glutenful and gluten-free), join the surf team, get paid to ride your bike to work, and of course, you'll be on the team of YouTube's biggest partner - social video's biggest player.

jobs.title: Event Design Industrial Engineer - CNC Router Technician
jobs.content:
Our firm is an award-winning event décor company located in Chicago, creating inspirational experiences for our clients throughout the country for over 20 years. We value exquisite designs, impeccable style, innovative ideas and sublime aesthetics, and we treasure creative team members who embody these same ideals. Do you believe in endless possibilities? Do you have a passion for events? If so, our company is for you.

We are seeking a talented industrial designer and CNC router technician to design new inventory, and supervise, plan, and direct router production to execute innovative designs. This is a unique opportunity to shine and collaborate with other creative team members company-wide to develop new design and décor ideas.

Some key responsibilities include:
• Producing router-based, custom build event designs for production and translating designs into production work.
• Establishing production schedules and managing production on the CNC Router.
• Creating renderings for design projects.
• Working with the graphics team to ensure file prep is correct.
• Managing the CNC shop including: supervising staff, establishing pricing guidelines, and managing inventory.
• Creating renderings for design projects.

Are most successful designers/technicians are able to handle competing demands with ease, manage deadlines, work independently, manage pricing and budgets, and delegate work flow effectively.

The ideal candidate has the following:
• A college degree in industrial design, architecture or theatre (specifically BA or BFA) (or comparable work experience) is preferred. Prior router technology/production experience is required.
• Working knowledge of vector-based 2D graphics software (including Illustrator, InDesign, AutoCAD or equivalent)
• Must be adept at working with Solidworks. Working knowledge of PETC and printer equipment. Working knowledge of 3D modeling software (including Rhino, 3D Studio Max, or equivalent)
• Working knowledge of router toolpathing and operating software (Enroute, or equivalent).

Experience in one or several of these areas are preferred as well:
• Carpentry skills and experience with woodworking.
• Experience with finishing and rigging of theatre scenery.
• Experience with basic metalworking and welding equipment.
• Experience with sculpting and painting techniques.

We expect our ideal person to be in the shop and office during the business day from Monday through Friday and be available at additional times as needed.

jobs.title: Design and Marketing Intern / Associate
jobs.content:
When it comes to creative licensing, brand management and representing leaders in Art, Fashion and Design Brands, we're kind of a big deal, but we need some sharp, confident go-getters to help us grow and become even better.

We are an international brand licensing and consulting company that helps manufacturers and marketers become greater and do more by providing high caliber content for products and promotional campaigns. We are currently seeking a dynamic, creative, organized recent college graduate or current student for a full- or part-time paid internship / associate position. Must be highly self-motivated, passionate, and eager to assist in all facets of creative and sales growth. We want and need people who like to wear many hats, and do so ambitiously.

The ideal candidate has excellent design, social media, brand strategy and research skills.

Here's what you'll be doing:
• developing marketing materials, customer pitches and brand decks using InDesign and Photoshop
• designing product mock-ups for customer specific pitches
• designing and coordinating social media (Instagram, Twitter, Facebook), email marketing (MailChimp) and website design (Squarespace)
• creating and modifying images and documents using InDesign, Photoshop and Illustrator, as well as Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint
• working with our sales team in researching new business opportunities and generating leads
• processing and organizing digital assets and archives
• photographing, sorting, archiving, packing and shipping product samples
• performing general office duties (handling correspondence and packages, answering phones, scanning documents, filing, etc)

Experience in design and marketing required. Interest in art, fashion, product development and/or sales helpful. *knowledge of Xcode is an extra plus.
Excellent experience and growth potential for the right person.

jobs.title: SENIOR SECURITY SOFTWARE ENGINEER - DORTMUND
jobs.content:
The opportunity


As a skilled Zalando Senior Security Software Engineer, you will analyze software designs and implementations from a security perspective of one of the world’s largest e-commerce platforms. You will identify and resolve security issues and include security analysis, defenses and countermeasures at each phase of the software development lifecycle to result in a robust software. You will challenge our status quo and help us define best practices for how we work. And you will have the freedom to launch your own open source projects, contribute to others’ projects, build internal community around your interests, and strengthen your personal brand—while receiving meaningful support at every step.

jobs.title: Research Engineer - Algorithms
jobs.content:
THE OPPORTUNITY

Zalando Technology is one of the most collaborative places you can imagine. Partnerships happen with all key engineering and product teams, the Zalando Research unit, and with the international tech community outside of Zalando. We are looking for research engineers to work on a broad set of real-world practical problems of massive scale that will have a direct and significant business impact.

As a Research Engineer, you will conduct algorithmic research, plus design and build the optimization engines for all logistics operations for Zalando. Your solutions will save millions of Euros and improve customer experience with faster package deliveries. You will have the freedom to challenge our status-quo and help us define best practices for how we work.

WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR
  • A degree in computer science, mathematics, statistics or other similar quantitative field (PhD, M.Sc.)
  • At least three years of professional / academic programming experience in an object oriented language or Scala
  • Strong analytical and critical thinking skills and a demonstrated ability to find creative solutions to algorithmic problems
  • Knowledge of graph theory, combinatorics and optimization methods
  • Experience in mathematical or algorithmic research
  • Willingness to work with microservice architecture, distributed systems and RESTful APIs
  • Knowledge of current trends in software design, architecture and web services
  • Effective communication skills and ability to understand business requirements
  • Deep skepticism of, plus the ability to identify and debunk buzzword mumbo jumbo, false assumptions and analysis
  • English language fluency


Additional Preferred Skills
  • Experience with building and / or running large-scale applications
  • Demonstrated expertise and desire to work hands-on in analyzing and modeling large data sets


YOUR ROLE
  • Research, design and implement algorithms to improve our optimization engines
  • Write code that your peers praise for its elegance and readability
  • Communicate effectively with our engineering and data science teams and use agile processes
  • Be accountable for all aspects of your work, from research and analysis to testing and deployment
  • Play a critical role in the team as a creative research engineer working on key results
  • Understand and communicate effectively with internal business customers, partners, and stakeholders
  • Think abstractly and discover correlations between problems, methodologies, and solutions.
  • Implement possible solutions, evaluate outcomes, and update research direction according to business goals and constraints
  • Follow a feature through its entire lifetime from problem formulation to solution delivery


WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT FROM US

Community. Tech culture of trust and empowerment, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, +100 internal technical and fun guilds, tech talks, product demos, Coderdojos, parties and events.

Perks. Competitive salary, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, public transport discounts, relocation assistance for internationals, free drinks and fruits, hardware of your choice.

Development. Tour of Mastery, extensive onboarding, personal branding support, opportunity to attend and speak at data science conferences and Meetups, and encouragement to publish work.

Work Environment. Self-organized, autonomous teams and flexible working hours.

Scale. Unparalleled levels of data and opportunities.



Want to join us? Then go ahead and apply!

If you need guidance or have any questions about our recruiting and hiring processes, please contact recruiter Sameer Shaikh.

jobs.title: Microsoft SQL-Server Administrator / Engineer
jobs.content:
The Opportunity

The team is responsible for MSSQL infrastructure within Zalando Tech and creates concepts, manages and operates the MSSQL infrastructure. It works closely with hardware and license management team together and integrates with IAM infrastructure.

What You Are Going To Do
  • Support, Development and Integration of existing MS-SQL clusters including design and creation of HA setup
  • You'll take ownership of Microsoft SQL Server related subjects
  • administration, installation and patching of complex Microsoft SQL environments, including cluster environments
  • Experience with virtualisation e.g. VMware, Hyper-V
  • Creation and Management of Microsoft SQL reports and analysis for both internal and external customers
  • Backup & recovery concepts & implementation as well as scripting to achieve automation


What We Expect From You
  • Successfully passed computer science university exam or comparable professional education
  • Several proven years' experience administering MS-SQL servers
  • Experience with Hyper-V or VMware virtualization technology
  • Experience with setup MSSQL clusters
  • Experience with backup, recovery and data storage for MSSQL servers and clusters
  • You are an engineer being able to analyse, plan & execute tasks & projects you took on board in a self-driven manner. You make sure your stakeholders are up to date.
  • You do communicate professionally in English
  • You are flexible, agile, service driven, a team player as well up to date with newest technologies in a self-driven manner


What We Offer

We are Zalando and we think big - what you do today will be seen by millions of people tomorrow. Working here means working for a fast-growing, international company with the aim of creating the best online fashion experience in the world:
  • Use of open source technology
  • Choice of operating system (Windows, Linux, MacOS)
  • State-of-the-art hardware
  • Take part in our internal 'tech talks' and our exchange programme with other Berlin startups
  • Take part in the Zalando mentoring programme
  • A unique corporate culture where results are what matter with a relaxed office environment
  • An international team of colleagues who will both inspire and support you
  • You'll never get bored - there's always something to do at Zalando


Want To Join Us?

Then we'd be more than happy to receive your application, which should include your earliest possible availability date as well as your desired salary. Please apply through our career portal.

Any further queries? Please do not hesitate to contact us via email // Alicja Notowska

jobs.title: Software Engineer, SAP
jobs.content:
The success of Zalando is also the history of cooperation of our exceptional team. We always welcome new contributors, move things and want to work with us at the Best Fashion Experience the world. Zalando Technology is the base of our e-commerce platform. From Shop via internal systems to logistics software we build customized in-house developments and adapt our software in short cycles to our processes.


WHAT WE EXPECT FROM YOU



  • You verfügst for a university degree in computer science, software engineering or equivalent qualification

  • You have SAP development experience and proven knowledge in ABAP / 4, ABAP Objects, BSP and / or ABAP WebDynpro.

  • You have experience with SAP FI-CA or FI modules

  • You have more than knowledge of interface development

  • You are tested in the implementation of SAP projects

  • Analytical thinking and structured operation characterize yourself

  • You work autonomously

  • Even in critical situations keeping the overview


YOUR TASKS WITH US



  • You aquire solutions and IT concepts in SAP Financials and HCM

  • You verantwortest the functional support and development of the existing processes in the area of financials and human resources

  • You develop ABAP, interfaces, forms and the SAP Business Workflow

  • You lead by functional tests, take this off and are creating technical documentation

  • You lead failure analysis and fault repairs for existing SAP ABAP programs by

  • You work actively in the redesign of processes in existing SAP applications in cooperation with the application consultants and departments with


WHAT'S WAITING FOR YOU



  • Fast-boarding through our 4-week mentoring program

  • the plan A Tech Academy and personal development through training and technical "People Leads" with you your tour-Of-Mastery

  • Internal Tech Talks and professional exchange with successful start-ups

  • Powerful Computer hardware (8 GB of RAM, SSD hard drives, 2x 24 "monitor)

  • Community: hack weeks, movie nights, coder dojos, +40 self-organized guilds tech

  • 40% Zalando shopping discount

  • A corporate culture in which you are demonstrating competence solely by results - we live the motto: Wear sneakers, not ties

  • An international team of experts that will leave you inspired and supported

  • new innovative projects with the latest SAP products

  • international and creative SAP team with currently 15 employees


INTERESTED?


We look forward to your application. Do you still have questions? Then you hesitate to contact Matthias Rempel under jobs@zalando.de

jobs.title: Software Engineer, Backend
jobs.content:
You Are Ready To Make An Impact


Zalando is transforming from Europe’s leading e-commerce company into a multi-service platform for fashion. From logistics, to big brands, to manufactures - we’re building the platform that connects all people and parts of the fashion ecosystem.


We live Radical Agility. With the set of principles that we give our teams - Autonomy, Mastery, Purpose - we entrust them to shape the future of Zalando. You will be the one changing the world’s opinion of tech and fashion in Europe.


What makes your individual impact at Zalando limitless is the possibility to tackle and create new opportunities. At Zalando, it is not only about growth and improvement - it is about inventing new things. We strongly believe that providing useful code to the world is a virtue. We strive to learn from and contribute to open source software for the betterment of Zalando and the tech community.





You Are Setting Standards


Variety. From Fashion Store to Brand Solutions to Business Assurance and Smart Logistics, you will join one of our 90+ teams to build, scale and continuously improve a variety of products that create value for our platform.


Autonomy. Based on our microservices architecture, you and your team will own your code, and decide on the technologies and tools to deliver as well operate large-scale applications on PaaS/SaaS cloud (AWS).


Ownership. You and your team will work like a startup and take ownership for the whole development cycle - from architecture design to testing to implementation and maintenance.


Excellence. You will join a team that is dedicated to delivering the highest standards when it comes to the quality of your code and implementation. You will add value by leveraging current trends in software design, architecture and web services.

Zalando is transforming from Europe’s leading e-commerce company into a multi-service platform for fashion. From logistics, to big brands, to manufactures - we’re building the platform that connects all people and parts of the fashion ecosystem.

jobs.title: Producer
jobs.content:
The Opportunity


As a producer you will be instrumental in supporting the development team in achieving excellence in terms of delivering software. You will help facilitate the lean development process, track progress against Key Performance Indicators and will help organize and support planning and other daily activities as the team requires. You will be expected to showcase your excellent organisational, problem solving and analytic skills.


What we are looking for



  • You have 4-5 years of Software Project Management or Software Product Management experience, ideally in an e-commerce company

  • You have sound knowledge and experience of managing and supporting software development using industry standard agile project management methodologies

  • You have effectively managed features and requirements documents, project management documents and team roadmaps.  You are able to bring a team together to craft a joined up plan, you understand risk mitigation and dependency management.

  • Activities such as Backlog grooming, Task Prioritization, Roadmap Management, Daily Standups, User stories, Jira, Product/Feature Mockups and Processes diagrams are in your DNA

  • You have strong communication skills and actively drive projects, breaking down complex problems into manageable, structured work packages. You effectively manage stakeholders and third party expectations and undertake periodic, appropriate reporting

  • You have drive and are you motivativated to get things done.  You lead by example, you talk data, you facilitate, you resolve, you negotiate and get things done

  • You thrive in an international environment and are fluent in verbal and written English 


Your Responsibilities



  • You will be the organizational engine of your team, responsible for managing product releases and executing the end-to-end integration plan

  • Your main focus will be on non-core-engineering tasks to enable successful end-to-end delivery and operation.  You will be expected to manage your team’s external project dependencies, external deliverables and roadmaps

  • You will refine requirements from Business KPIs, features and user stories

  • Your special focus will be on ensuring all end-to-end delivery tasks are completed for a successful product release

  • You will be part of an engineering team and you will play  key role in facilitating the team to take them forward. On a day-to-day basis, you will work very closely with the team and will facilitate taking decisions as a unit


What you can expect from us



  • Autonomy and trust to deliver using agile techniques in an entrepreneurial environment

  • A career development path developed jointly with you with potential for developing breadth and depth in skill set

  • A unique corporate culture where results are what matters, all within a relaxed office environment

  • A highly motivated international team of colleagues who will both inspire and support you


Want to join us? Then go ahead and apply!


If you need guidance or have any questions about our recruiting and hiring processes, please contact recruiter Manjuri Sinha at manjuri.sinha@zalando.de

jobs.title: Principal JavaScript Engineer
jobs.content:
We are looking for a Principal Front End Engineer to join our team developing cutting edge e-commerce experiences for recognizable brands including Saks Fifth Avenue, Saks OFF5TH, Lord & Taylor, and Hudson's Bay.


What You'll Do:



  • You will be part of a cross-functional team of developers, quality assurance, business, and creative. You will be working on front end application design, development, testing, deployment and maintenance with a focus on HTML, CSS, and JavaScript as well as participating in design and code reviews.

  • You will play a key role in building responsive, elegant web applications as well as maintaining and enhancing existing web applications while adhering to and improving our style guides and documentation.

  • Our teams collaborate with business and product teams using agile/scrum methodology, including product backlog grooming, sprint planning, daily stand-ups, review and retrospective.

  • With a large, technically diverse environment you are encouraged to create solutions for issues identified anywhere in our ecosystem.

jobs.title: Packaging Designer
jobs.content:
TITLE: Packaging Designer
DEPARTMENT: Design & Engineering
REPORTS TO: Industrial Design Manager
FLSA: Exempt

Job Summary

The Packaging Designer is responsible for creative, motivated structural packaging designs that can support our Design and Development teams. This includes the creation of packaging for a diverse range of products from soft goods to hard goods, for US and International markets. This is a key position with lots of responsibility, from initial ideation and comps to final dyelines.

Duties and Responsibilities

• Researches competitive packaging for each category and project as needed
• Develops innovative structural designs that are on-brand, cost effective, structurally sound and ready for mass production
• Responsible for schedule development and executing on-time
• Responsible for die-line creation and material specification
• Prototypes and presents work to internal teams for approvals throughout the development process
• Creates packaging samples/prototypes for evaluation and sales/marketing tools
• Works with brands and licenses to ensure packaging meet brand guidelines
• Be able to mock up final art and packaging for presentations and production
• Work closely with Graphic Design team to determine artwork and messaging layout
• Responsible for creating thorough, easy-to-follow packing instructions for vendors
• Responsible for reviewing vendor samples and commenting as needed
• Maintains library of existing packaging and materials
• Evaluates current departmental procedures through independent judgment and offers a recommendation for change to their immediate supervisor
• Create and present packaging concepts based on client/project parameters

Minimum Qualifications

• Bachelor’s degree in Packaging, Industrial Design, or related fields required
• 2-4 years of work experience in structural packaging specialty
• Solid skills in Adobe Creative Suite and Microsoft Office. 3D CAD skills in Rhino or
SolidWorks
• Knowledge of materials, including papers, boards, plastics and finishes
• Knowledge of printing/manufacturing/assembly process
• Ability to take initiative and prioritize tasks--good time-management, organizational and problem-solving skills
• Creative, with strong 3D geometric and problem-solving abilities

Physical Demands and Work Environment

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this position. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the functions.
While performing the duties of this position, the employee is regularly required to talk or hear. The employee frequently is required to use hands or finger, handle, or feel objects, tools or controls. The employee is occasionally required to stand; walk; sit; reach with hands and arms; climb or balance; and stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl.
The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 15 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this position include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, and the ability to adjust focus.
The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.

jobs.title: Senior Manager, Industrial Design & Human Factors - Medical Devices
jobs.content:
The Johnson & Johnson Medical Devices organization is seeking a multi-faceted, exceptionally talented, user-centered Senior Manager, Industrial Design & Human Factors (IDHF) who is passionate about improving the quality of people's lives through compelling design experiences. This position will be located within our Medical Devices campus in Raynham, MA.

With worldwide sales of over $27 billion, Johnson & Johnson Medical Devices is one of the world’s largest, most innovative surgical companies. The businesses represented in the J&J Medical Device sector are Acclarent, Advanced Sterilization Products, Biosense Webster, DePuySynthes, Ethicon, Mentor, and Sterilmed.

The Senior Manager, IDHF will embrace the various roles this position requires consisting of Usability Champion, Research-driven Innovator, Classic Industrial Designer, Brand Ambassador, Strategic Design Leader, and People Manager:

- Embrace human-centered design methodologies to identify what makes a product intuitive-to-use. Observe and interact within a clinical environment to identify and eliminate potential use errors early in the development process. Leverage insights to inspire others to think more empathically.
- Provide creative design leadership that uncovers new product opportunities. Work with the IDHF team and our customers to gather, synthesize and translate user research into device concepts that advance surgical care.
- Possess a strong understanding of "how things work" with an innate interest in materials and process. Ability to visualize and create concepts that meet cost targets, project schedule, manufacturing processes and hospital procedures. Collaborate and evolve existing visual brand language, as well as contribute to future design strategies.
- Collaborate across J&J to help build a compelling and unique brand presence in our market. Apply creativity to help influence a brand that fuses great product design with customer experience aspirations.
- Optimize IDHF's ability to execute great design within a complex healthcare environment. Ability to make decisions affecting resources (people, cost, and time), possess broad project management skills, and the ability to adjust between big picture thinking and product level details.
- Active contribution to the Global Medical Devices IDHF leadership team on strategic planning, organization design, and implementation approaches across multiple global locations.
- Management responsibility for organizational structure and professional development of ID|HF associates. Ensure associates have the resources, information, training and support to meet their objectives in a timely, competent and cost effective manner

Qualifications
- A BS/BA in Industrial Design, Human Factors, or related degree with a minimum of 10 years of relevant professional experience is required.
- The successful candidate must possess excellent visual communication skills using traditional sketching and digital media is required.
- Relevant experience leading multi-disciplinary product development teams and external partners is required.
- Self-directed activities focusing on development of product line strategies, planning flexible department structures & supporting change as corporate structure evolves. Able to achieve a balance of daily departmental operation & individual work load is required.
- Demonstrated ability to effectively recruit, develop, manage and coach associates to strengthen organizational capabilities around product design is required
- Experience with department administration, including operating within expense & capital budgets is required.
- Experience with the design and development of healthcare products, regulated industry, surgical procedures/experiences, and knowledge of hospital environments are preferred.
- Additional skills and hands-on experiences that augment the design process (e.g., Human Factors Engineering, Cognitive Psychology, Graphic Design, Information Design, Interaction Design, Mechanical Engineering, Clinical Experience…etc.) is preferred.
- This position may require 15% travel and will be located in Raynham, MA.

jobs.title: Senior Industrial Designer
jobs.content:
The Johnson & Johnson Medical Devices organization is is recruiting for a Senior Industrial Designer who is passionate about improving the quality of people's lives through compelling design experiences. This position will be located within our Medical Devices campus in Raynham, MA.

With worldwide sales of over $27 billion, Johnson & Johnson Medical Devices is one of the world’s largest, most innovative surgical companies. The businesses represented in the J&J Medical Device sector are Acclarent, Advanced Sterilization Products, Biosense Webster, DePuySynthes, Ethicon, Mentor, and Sterilmed.

DePuy Synthes is a Johnson & Johnson company that is one of the leaders in the medical device industry. Our implants and instruments are used by orthopaedic surgeons to treat patients with conditions resulting from traumatic injuries, degenerative diseases, deformities, and sports related injuries. Our environment is entrepreneurial, learning-driven, and is as challenging as it is rewarding.

DePuy Synthes Companies of Johnson & Johnson is the largest, most innovative and comprehensive orthopaedic and neurological business in the world. DePuy Synthes Companies will offer an unparalleled breadth and depth of products, services and programs in the areas of joint reconstruction, trauma, spine, sports medicine, neurological, craniomaxillofacial, power tools and biomaterials. Building on the legacy and strengths of two great companies, we are creating one organization that will be agile and better equipped in today's evolving health care environment. With a focus on activating insights to develop innovative, comprehensive solutions, we are inspired to advance patient care in greater ways than either company could accomplish on its own.

DePuy Synthes Mitek Sports Medicine offers innovative solutions in sports medicine for the treatment of soft tissue injuries.

The mission of the Industrial Design & Human Factors (IDHF) group is to create compelling user experiences that are intuitive, holistic and branded. Using human-centered innovation, Design Thinking methodologies, and brand-driven design strategies we aim to create a portfolio of surgical tools that are as sophisticated and precise as the procedures they perform.

The Senior Industrial Designer will be diverse in their thinking, capabilities and experiences embodying the following attributes necessary for success:

Human Factors/ Usability Champion. Use human-centered design methodologies to identify what makes the product intuitive-to-use. Gain insights from observing highly skilled ‘Key Opinion Leaders’ as well as complete novices as they interact with existing products, sketch models, and prototypes. Identify and eliminate potential use errors early in the development process.

Research-driven Innovator. Provide creative design leadership that uncovers new product opportunities. Work face-to-face with our customers, gather, synthesize and convert user research into purposefully innovative concepts that differentiate DePuy Synthes in the market.

Classic Industrial Designer. Possess a strong mechanical aptitude with an innate interest in materials and process. Use traditional sketching and CAD tools to create concepts that meet cost targets, project schedule, manufacturing processes and hospital procedures. Collaborate to evolve established visual brand language and contribute to future design strategies.

Brand Ambassador. Collaborate across the DePuy Synthes Franchise and J&J to help build a compelling and unique brand presence in our market. Apply your creativity to help create a brand that fuses great product design with customer aspirations.

Strategic Design Planner. Optimize IDHF's ability to execute great design within a complex environment. You must possess broad project management skills and the ability to seamlessly switch between big picture thinking and product-level details.

Qualifications
+ To be considered for the role a minimum of a Bachelor’s Degree in Industrial Design or equivalent required.
+ At least four years of experience applying user-centered design principles and branding throughout the product development process is required.
+ Creative capacity to conceptualize designs, develop and identify alternative solutions to problems must be demonstrated, along with the ability to communicate using 2D visualization, 3D CAD modeling and presentation skills.
+ Proficient time management, project planning and tracking skills are critical.
+ Experience identifying user needs and requirements through user research, observing people using products is preferred for this role.
+ Experience with the regulated industry is required. especially an understanding of medical device usability standards, is preferred.

For consideration, please submit PDF or provide link to web-based portfolio of sample work.

This position is located in Raynham, MA and may require up to 10% travel including international.

BE VITAL in your career, Be seen for the talent you bring to your work. Explore opportunities within the Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies.

jobs.title: Principal Industrial Designer
jobs.content:
The Johnson & Johnson Medical Devices Industrial Design and Human Factors team is seeking a multi-faceted, exceptionally talented, user-centered Principal Industrial Designer who is passionate about improving the quality of people's lives through compelling design experiences. This position will be located within our Medical Devices campus at Irvine, California

With worldwide sales of over $27 billion, Johnson & Johnson Medical Devices is one of the world’s largest, most innovative surgical companies. The businesses represented in the J&J Medical Device sector are Acclarent, Advanced Sterilization Products, Biosense Webster, DePuySynthes, Ethicon, Mentor, and Sterilmed.

The role of Principal Industrial Designer will join the West Coast section of the JnJ IDHF team to partner with internal and external stakeholders, and lead Industrial Design and Usability activities on projects across four diverse business platforms based in Irvine CA, (Acclarent, Advanced Sterilization Products, Biosense Webster, Mentor). Collaboration across the greater JnJ IDHF team will also be part of the role, helping shape best practices in usability and design.

The Principal Industrial Designer will embrace the various roles this position requires consisting of Design Leader, User Centered Research Champion, Classic Industrial Designer, and Strategic Partner:
+ Providing input into the planning and execution of product development programs - ensuring there is time and resources for the appropriate design activities.
+ Collaborating with internal and external partners to plan and execute user research in real and simulated environments - reviewing and synthesizing data to uncover new opportunities and unmet needs, identify potential use errors and develop solutions to mitigate safety risks.
+ Using traditional sketching, digital tools, CAD models, and physical mock-ups to communicate unique ideas and product concepts - sharing ideas with various audiences and leveraging skills of collaboration and influence to drive alignment behind the best solution.
+ Deploying design thinking methodologies to help our business partners visualize abstract concepts and leverage IDHF's position in the organization to shape the future of our business.

Qualifications
+ BS/BA in Industrial Design or related design degree with a minimum of 10 years of relevant professional experience is required.
+ The successful candidate must possess excellent visual communication skills using traditional and current sketching and digital technology (Photoshop, Illustrator, PowerPoint, etc or similar) Proficiency using CAD tools (Alias, SolidWorks, etc or similar) to create 3D databases that capture design intent and are suitable for downstream applications are required.
+ Relevant experience working with design for manufacturing in multi-disciplinary product development teams and external partners is required.
+ Experience with medical device development and regulated landscape and familiarity with Usability Engineering processes is preferred.
+ Experience with the design and development of physical products and/or capital equipment and systems is preferred.
+ Additional skills and hands-on experiences that augment the design process is preferred (e.g., Human Factors Engineering, Cognitive Psychology, Graphic Design, Information Design, Interaction Design, Mechanical Engineering, Clinical Experience…etc.)
+ This position may require
For consideration, please submit a PDF, or provide link to web-based, portfolio that demonstrates successful products, an established creative process and proficiency with design and prototyping methodologies.

BE VITAL in your career, Be seen for the talent you bring to your work. Explore opportunities within the Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies.

jobs.title: DIGITAL PRODUCT DESIGN MANAGER
jobs.content:
Digital Product Design Manager

Fetch is looking for a Digital Product Design Manager to join the Marketing Department to assist in the development, maintenance and implementation of various projects – balancing many on any given day. This person must be able to design digital ads, web graphics, e-blasts, business presentations, infographics, branding, newsletters, social media assets and print collateral (brochures, posters, postcards). Photography, video and animation storyboarding skills are preferred. They must show an ability to prioritize and manage workload and meet project timelines and deliverable dates as well as give and receive constructive criticism around design ideas and execution. Teamwork is essential to success in the Digital Product Design Manager role.

This position will not only require someone with an eye for innovative design but also someone who can focus on the bigger picture and manage work against high level business objectives. You should be execution focused, with an owner mentality that’s willing to roll up your sleeves and do whatever is necessary.

Job Requirements:
• Experience in design across a wide range of platforms (Digital, Tradeshow, Product, Print)
• Ability to design based on the bigger picture, keeping high level strategic goals at the center of your work.
• Ability to be the department designer but also manage internal and external creative projects.
• Excellent verbal communication, written communication and presentation skills
• Strong computer (mac & PC) proficiency and working knowledge of InDesign, Photoshop, Illustrator and Office.
• Bachelor’s degree required.
• Experience working with Amazon’s Vendor Central a plus.
• Experience designing consumer goods a plus.
Duties & Responsibilities:
Design:
• Marketing and sales presentations.
• Tradeshow and retail advertising.
• Marketing collateral including digital ads, coupons, posts, sell sheets, video, etc.
• Brand assets including logos, taglines, product images, packaging, displays, etc.
• Infographics based on research to support product development and sales.
• Ideation and Execution: Own all aspects of design for marketing activities.
• Creative/Brand Strategy: Participate in marketing and brand discussions to push the boundaries on company marketing initiatives.
Marketing Support:
• Stay informed, identify and define pet industry trends.
• Provide insight into displays, signage and packaging trends.
• Ideate on marketing campaigns, B2B selling solutions, marketing/sales collateral and building brand awareness.
• Use analytics and customer feedback to identify what is and is not working.
Asset Management
• Maintain product image library.
• Maintain Amazon and other e-commerce listings.
• Manage company brand assets (business cards, letterhead, templates, folders, etc.)
Website Management
• Maintain company website design and photography.
• Support marketing team in development of brand websites and landing pages.


Starting salary is $50,000. Benefits (health, vision, dental) included. 401k available after one year of employment.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer .NET
jobs.content:
Senior Software Engineer .NET

Voortman Steel Machinery | Engineering | Rijssen | WO

Wat doe je als Senior Software Engineer .NET bij Voortman?

De afdeling Software Engineering kent een twintigtal .NET en PLC engineers verdeeld over drie verschillende teams; Beams, Plates en Common. Onze engineers zijn verantwoordelijk voor het zelfstandig ontwikkelen van creatieve maatwerkoplossingen voor de eigen VACAM programmatuur die we binnen Voortman Steel Machinery gebruiken om onze machines te besturen.

Binnen het team Plates zijn wij momenteel bezig met de ontwikkeling van een nieuw type snijmachine, de V325. Deze machine is de volgende generatie na onze huidige V304. In verband met deze ontwikkeling zijn wij op zoek naar een ervaren Software Engineer als nieuwe collega voor ons huidige team. Je bent betrokken bij de totale lifecycle van deze nieuwe machine; van design tot het testen en de uiteindelijke overdracht. De uitdagingen hierbinnen zijn veelzijdig, omdat ze betrekking hebben op vrijwel alle denkbare functionaliteiten van een machine. Hiervoor werk je samen in een multidisciplinair team van mechanical, electrical en software engineers. Met elkaar zorg je voor een topresultaat zodat we voorop blijven lopen in de wereld van industri√´le automatisering.

In de basis ken je de volgende verantwoordelijkheden:

  • Begeleiden en instrueren van junior/medior Software Engineers
  • Bewaken voortgang en kwaliteit van de verschillende projecten
  • Vertalen van de klantwensen naar ontwerp, architectuur en interface
  • Realiseren, testen en in bedrijf stellen van de te ontwikkelen software
  • Heldere overdracht van het product naar je collega‚Äôs

Wat verwachten wij van jou?

Graag verwelkomen wij een nieuw collega als Senior Software Engineer die zichzelf herkent in het volgende profiel:

  • Je hebt een afgeronde HBO of WO opleiding richting Informatica of Technische Informatica
  • Je hebt minimaal 5 jaar relevante werkervaring in het object geori√´nteerd ontwerpen en programmeren in C# .NET en/of Java
  • Je bent accuraat, flexibel, teamspeler en stressbestendig
  • In verband met het internationale karakter van ons bedrijf heb je een goede beheersing van de Engelse taal

Wat mag je van ons verwachten?

Voortman Steel Machinery kenmerkt zich door de combinatie van hoogwaardige techniek, veel ruimte voor ondernemerschap en een innovatieve drive. Onze cultuur is te omschrijven als informeel, onze collega‚Äôs zijn betrokken en initiatiefrijk. Naast een marktconform salaris bieden wij 27 vakantiedagen, 5 vastgestelde ADV dagen, een betrouwbaar pensioenfonds, reiskostenvergoeding, flexibele werktijden en brede ontwikkelingsmogelijkheden.Spreekt het werken in een dergelijke internationaal georienteerde omgeving jou aan? Dan ben je van harte welkom om samen de mogelijkheden te bespreken.

Voortman Steel Machinery

Voortman Steel Machinery (onderdeel van Voortman Steel Group) ontwerpt, ontwikkelt en vervaardigt al ruim 45 jaar hoogwaardige CNC gestuurde machines en volledige productielijnen voor de internationale staalbouw en plaatverwerkende industrie. Met internationale dochterondernemingen, verantwoordelijk voor verkoop en service, is Voortman Steel Machinery wereldwijd een erkende leverancier met ruim duizend ge√Ønstalleerde systemen. Door continue focus op innovatie en verbetering is Voortman Steel Machinery al jaren een toonaangevende speler in de markt. Met een gemiddelde leeftijd van 32 jaar bruizen wij van de energie. Onze ruim 250 medewerkers cre√´ren een dynamische en veeleisende omgeving, waarin innovatieve en creatieve idee√´n worden omgezet in hoogwaardige technologische oplossingen.

Sollicitatie

Wanneer jij graag meer te weten komt over jouw mogelijkheden als Senior Software Engineer dan gaan wij graag het kennismakingsgesprek met je aan! Graag ontvangen wij jouw CV en motivatiebrief via de link. Liever eerst nog meer informatie? Neem contact op met Jorien van den Akker (Corporate Recruiter): 0548 536373.

De Voortman Steel Group verzorgt zelf de werving en selectie van onze nieuwe collega's. Acquisitie door externe partijen wordt dan ook nadrukkelijk niet op prijs gesteld.

Trefwoorden: Vacature, Fulltime, Almelo, Software developer, IT, .NET engineer.

jobs.title: Senior Graphic Designer
jobs.content:
Our boutique branding agency, located in TriBeCa, is seeking a senior, full-time graphic designer to join a tight-knit, multidisciplinary creative team. The right candidate will be comfortable laying the conceptual foundation for all projects, overseeing the execution of each campaign, and designing for key clients. In terms of experience, we're looking with someone with 5+ years, who is perhaps ready to take on their first title as creative director.

We design in nearly every print and digital medium, with special emphasis on consumer packaging design. Given our wide variety of clients, and our constantly growing pipeline, the right candidate will feel confident juggling multiple projects at once. This position reports directly to our Director of Innovation, while working closely with fellow designers, strategists, and project managers. The position demands strong interpersonal skills, both in terms of communicating with clients and fellow designers.

Responsibilities:
• Oversee all design development and production of websites, brochures, company decks, packaging design, web design, promotional videos, and more.
• Develop entire brand identity systems – including logo, typography, imagery style, and more – for entirely new brands.
• Organize and direct photo shoots, retouch photos, and design tradeshow booths, from concept to completion.

Core Technical Expertise:
• Photoshop
• Illustrator
• InDesign
• 3D Modeling / Rendering

Additional Technical Abilities:
• Premier Pro
• After Effects
• Sketchup
• Responsive Web Design

Please respond with your availability, and expected compensation.

jobs.title: Full Stack Developer
jobs.content:
This is a rare and exciting opportunity for a successful candidate to be part of a dynamic, rapidly moving and award winning ad tech start up. Adludio is a the leading Programmatic Sensory Advertising platform, offering a unique portfolio of next gen mobile-first ad formats. Adludio is developing a self-serve user platform, to allow any person to design and create amazing ads, and to deliver them via programmatic solutions that best meet their needs. We aim to marry intuitive touch-screen user experiences and creative excellence, and make that the norm for mainstream mobile advertising.

Job Description

We are looking for a Full Stack Developer responsible for managing the interchange of data between the server and the users, as well as designing the overall architecture of the web application and evolve it to ensure maximum performance and stability. Your primary focus will be development of all server-side logic, definition and maintenance of the central database.

Responsibilities

  • Design of the overall architecture of the web application
  • Implementation of a robust set of services and APIs to power the web application
  • Building reusable code and libraries for future use
  • Optimization of the application for maximum speed and scalability
  • Implementation of security and data protection
  • Event tracking on the front-end
  • Integration of the front-end and back-end aspects of the web application
  • Identify, communicate, and propose solutions effectively
  • Troubleshoot and support existing applications and systems
  • Integrate applications by designing database architecture and server scripting
  • Dev ops on AWS

Skills and Qualifications

  • Proficient knowledge of a back-end programming language: Node.Js
  • Understanding differences between multiple delivery platforms (such as mobile vs desktop)
  • Creating database schemas that represent and support business processes
  • Strong understanding of RDBMS, SQL, and NOSQL alternatives
  • Data migration, transformation, and scripting
  • Management of hosting environment, including database administration and scaling an application to support load changes
  • Understanding of fundamental design principles behind a scalable application
  • Ability to implement automated testing platforms and unit tests
  • Good understanding of ReactJS ( Redux ).
  • Proficient understanding of client-side scripting: javascript.
  • Proficient understanding of code versioning tools, Git preferred.
  • Familiarity with development aiding tools, such as webpack
  • Basic knowledge of streaming databases, I.e kinesis.
  • Understanding big data workloads

Qualifications:

*BA/BS degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field preferred

Headquarters: New York City
URL: why.clevertech.biz

About You

You're a master with Node.js and love trying out new languages, frameworks, libraries, and leveraging them off, whenever necessary.

You're organized and you don't need to tell people about it. It shows.

You offer fullstack ability, believe the power of open source solutions, and always have scalability in the back of your mind.

You can jump into projects, review code, suggest improvements, and create trust in clients. You‚Äôre never afraid to get your hands dirty in code.

You can take ownership of a project, fill in the gaps, and ensure production ready releases.

About Clevertech

15 years developing apps has taught us this: Build people, then products.

We‚Äôre aware that solid engineering practices and our love of Agile principles aren‚Äôt enough to ensure that we translate our clients‚Äô dreams into software that shapes the world.

Our team of nearly 100 developers and designers are what make it possible.

They‚Äôve rejected offers from Google and Twitter. They‚Äôre parents, travelers, or aspiring entrepreneurs. Some are in the planning stages of launching their own startups. Here‚Äôs what they have in common: 

They‚Äôre all invested in becoming better together and we support their constant learning. 

For more on how we do this, check out why.clevertech.biz. Some of the great things we do together are captured in cleverte.ch/bloomberg and visualcaptcha.net. We're also proud to be one of FlexJob's 100 Top Companies to Watch for Remote Jobs in 2016. The list goes on!

About the Job

At Clevertech, we understand why it‚Äôs great to be part of the gig economy‚Äîwe also understand some of the challenges it can present. 

By offering ongoing, full-time roles, we eliminate the burnout and guesswork involved in being a contract worker. We‚Äôre also interested in making it possible for our team to focus on what they do best. Busy work that gets in the way of high-quality code is our worst enemy!

Here‚Äôs how it works:

* We work with quality clients who have brilliant ideas they want to scale, scale, scale :)
* You can be located anywhere. This is a remote position. (And you're excited about it!)
* Schedules are flexible‚Äîyou work when you're in flow
* You focus on one client at a time; when you're finished with one, we provide another
* We use the latest tools and streamline every workflow imaginable
* Everyone on our team shares your culture, irrespective of where they are physically

jobs.title: Web and Visual Designer
jobs.content:
Join our creative, passionate team that is helping our clients reach and delight their customers through integrated marketing.

As a designer at Blend, you’ll be a creative problem-solver. Our design team is responsible for helping clients achieve their business and marketing objectives by creating unified brand experiences across all customer touchpoints.

= What You’ll Do =
• Design a variety of projects ranging from identity, print, website UI/UX and other digital applications.
• Work on mobile and responsive web design sites, translating user stories into wireframes and prototypes that create great user experiences.
• Be involved throughout the entire process from concept to completion—including research, brainstorming, layout and producing final press or web-ready artwork.
• Collaborate with our creative team and account partners to understand client needs and develop appropriate solutions
• Solicit feedback on your work as part of refining your design skill and ensuring the best outcomes.
• Think about the design needs of the client and propose solutions—outside the box when needed, but within any constraints as requested.
• Continue your learning by being involved in the design community, attending learning events, and reading.

= About You =
• You have some experience under your belt, know how things work and want to take on new design challenges.
• You have a strong portfolio, especially focused on website & digital design, demonstrating a keen understanding of good design principles and attention to detail.
• You have excellent written and verbal communication skills and can present ideas clearly to others.
• You’re a divergent thinker. While you know how to draw inspiration from others, your work and your thinking is not entirely derivative.
• You work well with input from others and design according to creative direction in a wide variety of styles.
• You’re passionate about both quality and deadlines, and you know how to balance them.
• You’re a problem-solver. You understand that good design must be as useful as it is beautiful. So you are really good at asking questions to learn the client’s objectives before starting a project.
• People love working with you because you’re super smart and talented, but you’re also humble and genuinely nice.

= Qualifications =
• 5 - 7+ years professional, post-collegiate experience in the design field
• Experience in both print and digital design, especially in designing responsive websites
• Working knowledge of CSS and HTML
• Bonus: BS / BA / BFA degree in Graphic Design or related field
• Bonus: front-end development experience (although the position does not require any coding)

= Benefits =
• Competitive salary with 11.5 paid holidays, PTO, family health insurance (100% of premiums plus first $1000 of your deductible), dental, vision, long-term and short-term disability insurance.

= About Blend Marketing =
Blend is an integrated marketing agency with a relentless focus on customer experience. We help companies deliver consistent, and seamless experiences through every interaction customers have with your brand—anywhere, anytime.

- Our Culture -
It's possible to be both laid back and passionate. We have a team of people who prove it every day. One minute we can be rigorously debating strategic options for a client, the next we can be playing ping-pong together. There's no competition here, but we push each other and ourselves to be the best at what we do.

Our core values are love, excellence, initiative, humility, creativity, fun, honesty, learning, and contagious passion. We'll talk about those quite a bit when we meet, because every one of us at Blend cares deeply about them, and anyone who joins our team will value them too.

- Our Clients and Work -
We're redesigning and updating our site to add our latest projects and clients. In the meantime, you can see a small snapshot of our work at https://goo.gl/tV6FjL.

jobs.title: Interactive Designer
jobs.content:
Parachute Health Solutions—a growing healthcare IT startup—is searching for talented interactive designers to join our team. We’re looking for exceptional multi-disciplinary designers to help develop and distinguish Parachute’s emerging product portfolio and brand position from our competitors. Our ideal candidates have a strong design background, experience building web applications, and a passion for healthcare reform.

As an interactive designer, you will be instrumental in the design and development of Parachute’s suite of healthcare-focused web applications. You will contribute to pixel-perfect UI/ UX design, front-end development, brand strategy, and creative direction.

As an integral member of our team, you’ll be relied on to:

● Collaborate closely with Parachute’s software development team to design and develop responsive end-user interfaces using single page application and CSS frameworks
● Use industry-standard design tools to wireframe and prototype user experiences and interfaces
● Analyze user flows and feedback to refine interfaces
● Develop and maintain design standards and UI patterns
● Help produce branded communications and marketing materials detailing product strategy and features.
● Help guide creative direction and branding of the company including maintaining company website

Key Perks:

● Competitive Compensation
● Free Lunch
● Hoverboards
● Oh, did we mention health insurance?

Required Skills:

● An academic and/or professional background in interaction design, visual communications, or a related field
● A strong portfolio with examples of your outstanding work
● A deep understanding of UI/UX Concepts and best practices
● Responsive web design experience including website and web application development using a modern grid framework or custom styling

jobs.title: Graphic Designer ‚Äì Branding/Licensing
jobs.content:
We are currently seeking a full-time Graphic / Package Designer to join our team. Duties include but not limited to: product design/ development, package design, photo-retouching, catalog layouts, and product photography.

Our company designs & develops many products in-house including Picture Frames, Slippers, RC Toys, Consumer Electronics, and Home-Goods, just to name a few. Although our company has a broad range of products, this position is for our electronics department.

We are looking for a designer that has knowledge of todays latest tech trends. This is a very fast-paced environment. Attention to detail and organization are very important qualities that we will be looking for.

Applications will not be considered without a link to your portfolio or attached samples of work.

Responsibilities:
• Execute the entire design process from research/development through design and sample review.
• Ability to take a project from start to finish while managing other assignments at the same time.
• Create/maintain product and packaging specs for your jobs.
• Send initial, revised, and final spec packages to overseas offices in timely manner.
• Send clear and comprehensive comments on production and pre-production samples in a timely manner.
• Communicate daily with overseas factories to resolve issues.
• Attend and take notes during design reviews.
• Manage production of product catalog, catalog production staff and photography as well as all print-ad and marketing materials.
• Demonstrate visible leadership at the team and division level, and initiate the opportunities for continuous improvement.

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to utilize Illustrator, InDesign and Photoshop at a high level. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.
• Knowledge of basic Adobe Suite programs and Mac OS.
• Strong knowledge of product development and technical spec procedures.
• Minimum of 4 years of professional experience, but portfolios can speak for themselves.
• Must be proficient in basic math and geometry.
• Good verbal and written communication skill required.
• Solid comprehension of various manufacturing materials and processes in order to develop an original and innovative product line.


Compensation: DOE
Location: Midtown Manhattan

jobs.title: Cotiviti Labs Team Senior Developer
jobs.content:
PRINCIPLE PURPOSE OF JOB:


Developers with the Cotiviti Labs team are responsible for working with a global team of medical doctors and business experts to create break-through solutions for incredibly difficult problems. In 2015 we found $3.2B in health system inefficiencies. We use a combination of innovative and proven technologies game-changing solutions


We use a combination of innovative and proven technologies game-changing solutions into production as quickly as possible. Our solutions are scalable, elastic, concurrent, parallel, and deliver results to our clients in real-time.  We are a Scala functional programming shop but are willing to use the best technologies to get into production quickly.  Our DevOps team members have created a sophisticated ChatOps infrastructure that supports everything from deployments, to releases, to provisioning new clients. Our continuous integration and build facilities are world class.


The Labs team has a flat organizational structure so people on this team have no direct managers, are responsible for their own work assignments, and will receive and give quarterly 360 reviews from their peers. We have no deadlines, only a requirement to move as fast as humanly possible and make every minute count. To thrive in this environment team member must have a passion for computer science, technology, innovation, and delivery.


We value teamwork above everything. We succeed together as a team and are accountable to each other for that success. Though we are scattered across the world we regularly get together to have fun. If you are looking for such a tribe apply now.


ESSENTIAL JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:


Primary Responsibilities



  • Work with our team to accelerate our research into production

  • Research open source libraries for code that can accelerate development

  • Constantly work to identify to speed up the development process

  • Identify training or coaching opportunities that can accelerate team members

  • Search for an experiment with new technologies that could accelerate development and deployment

  • Work with a global, multi-cultural team to understand complex business requirements

  • Write code that is beautiful, tested, and commented that you will want to tell your grandchildren about

  • Making practical decisions that will deliver value to customers quickly

  • Review and merge Pull Requests from team members

  • Identify and implement technologies that can improve the quality of our code.

  • Write excellent documentation



  • Actively promotes and participates in brainstorming sessions



  • Establish and maintain the highest level of integrity with your team members


Other Related Responsibilities



  • Contribute to Cotiviti and other open source projects

  • Present at and attend conferences

jobs.title: Packaging/ GraphicDesigner
jobs.content:
Graphic Designer- New Product Development

Astor Chocolate is a premier chocolate manufacturer, with a foundation of quality based on three core strengths – Innovation, Creativity and Dedication. Our goal is to provide our customers with products of unparalleled quality, leaving a lasting impression of distinction. This can only happen with a strong team of professionals leading the way in an energetic goal oriented atmosphere. The very success of Astor’s phenomenal growth lies in our commitment to developing our employees’ ability to contribute to their greatest potential. With a team of upbeat, talented, motivated people, we will continue to move forward as a market leader, servicing our customers with excellence and dedication.

Astor’s 120,000 square foot state of the art facility houses a multi-faceted chocolate manufacturing plant with a fully integrated design/ print department, allowing for the creation of truly impressive line of products.

As our Packaging Designer you will be an ideas driven conceptual thinker with the ability to influence the branding world. Expect to be able to research new concepts, produce mock up sketches, brainstorm ideas and communicate designs with 3D visuals. You will be liaising with internal teams including, Marketing, Trends, Pre-press to produce creative concepts that not only fulfill the brief but exceed expectations. But most of all, you will be joining a company with 65 years of creativity behind it, that will keep you invigorated. If you excel at creating compelling packaging and displays that drives product sales and thrive in an entrepreneurial, fast-paced environment, we want to hear from you.

Responsibilities:

• Conceptualizes and translates graphic and packaging design trends to create innovative, aesthetically pleasing packaging solutions for Astor’s customer base.
• Works with Marketing, Product Management, and Design to create and execute packaging that have structural integrity and increase sell-through in Astor’s marketplaces.
• Keeps up to speed on packaging trends and technological advances to maintain our brands’ competitive edge.
• Responsibilities include concept and design new structures and products updating and revising current designs, creating mock-ups and creating new layouts/design.
• Execute the design and production of strategic packaging and branding for in-house, private label and contract consumer packaged goods from concept to completion.
• Work in tandem with others in design team to maximize their design projects.

Qualifications

• BFA or BA in art, packaging design or graphic design or the equivalent.
• The successful candidate will possess a minimum of 3-6 years of graphic design experience. An emphasis in consumer packaged goods for the confectionery, beauty, beverage, fashion or home industry is preferred.
• Individuals with strong foundational skills such as self-motivation, responsibility, communication skills (oral and written), detail-oriented, and the ability to manage multiple items simultaneously are most important.
• Demonstrated excellence in design, creative thought, problem solving and the creative ability to imagine and demonstrate ideas.
• Should be able to work with different materials and understand their capabilities as well as their limitations
• An eye for emerging new trends with a passion to excel and challenge the traditions of packaging design

Our goal is to energize, equip and develop extraordinary people to drive unpredicted results. We are looking for talented people to join our team of passionate professionals!
Please send your resume to resumes@astorchocolate.com

Visit us @ www.astorchocolate.com

jobs.title: Site Reliability Engineer
jobs.content:
As a Site Reliability Engineer at Rails Machine, your primary goals will be to ensure our customer‚Äôs applications are available, fast, and secure. Our customers need the best service, support, and products, and we need you to help us deliver.

We offer two main products: managed infrastructure and managed operations. Through managed infrastructure, we provide automation, infrastructure, and scalability in our own data center on our own hardware. We provide both bare-metal and virtualized hosting options for our customers, and you‚Äôll work directly with them to ensure their goals are met through automation, analysis, and hardware. And via managed operations, we provide custom, consulting-based solutions on top of any cloud vendor, as best meets the customer‚Äôs needs.

We give our customers the ability to reach out to us like they would an internal DevOps team!

You‚Äôll work with virtualization and container technologies, and setup and automate high availability data clusters (MySQL Galera, PostgreSQL replication, Redis failover, ElasticSearch clustering, Memcached, MongoDB etc.). You'll manage application instances built with Ruby-on-Rails and Elixir/Phoenix (to name a few) and layer on top of those management, orchestration, monitoring, and alerting for fleets of instances. If you‚Äôve ever wanted to work at a scale that few companies do, you‚Äôll find the right challenge here at Rails Machine!

Responsibilities:

  • Manage availability and performance problems for customers; automate resolution to prevent reoccurrence
  • Pair with other SREs and Systems Administrators, document solutions, knowledge sharing
  • Release and maintain open-source software and projects
  • Author blog posts and participate in the community by going to meetups, conferences, etc. as a Rails Machine representative
  • Creates and maintain system architecture, design, and implementation

Minimum Qualifications :

  • Proficient in Ruby with additional experience in C/C++, Python, Elixir, Java, or JavaScript preferred
  • Significant experience with config management or automation framework, like Chef, Puppet, Ansible, Capistrano
  • 4 years maintaining production infrastructure on a Linux environment
  • Intermediate Ubuntu system administration skills
  • Strong customer service skills
  • Self Motivated and Diligent
  • Ability to participate in on-call/pager rotation
  • U.S. Residents only please
  • Hiring Junior to Senior Levels

jobs.title: Software Engineers
jobs.content:
Our engineers are the heart of Improbable. We solve some of the hardest problems around distributed systems, high-performance cloud infrastructures, messaging and much more. Together we are building a world-class engineering organisation to usher in the age of Strong Simulation; our platform, SpatialOS, allows developers to build massive, richly detailed simulations across thousands of machines in the cloud. 


We use the right tool for the job and believe in well-tested, robust code. A lot of our core-systems are built in Java with areas of C++, GoLang, Scala & Javascript. We also leverage a lot of open-source (CoreOS, etcd, Fleet, Docker, Prometheus, gRPC) and give back to the community when we can: http://bit.ly/294ROMv


We are hiring across of all of our teams, with a lot of opportunity to work on a diverse range of projects such as:



  • designing and implementing new algorithms to distribute and scale our simulations

  • integrating new workers with our distributed stack

  • core infrastructure that underpins seamless scaling (networking, packing, storage, containers, logging, security across all compute providers)

  • creation of world-class, robust APIs and SDKs for external customers

  • developing tooling to understand, visualize and reason about large real-time simulations

  • researching new applications of our tech and developing proof of concepts

  • customer facing roles working with world-class organisations to explore the possibilities of SpatialOS

jobs.title: Front-End Developer (Shopify)
jobs.content:
We are a small eCommerce design and development agency, based in Bristol, UK.
