jobs.title: I'm a roadie for Coolblue! Creating stability behind the scenes!
jobs.content:
As a PHP Developer at Coolblue you will make sure our web shops are ridiculously fast and meticulously kept.

What you tell your friends you do
"I build web shops. And no – I will not fix your computer."

What you will really be doing
  • Coming up with new functionalities and building them.
  • Improving the technology that runs over 300 web shops.
  • Improving the user-friendliness of all of those web shops.
  • Working in teams, consisting of 5 (+/- 2) developers and designers. 
How will you be doing this?
  • You are an all-rounder in a Scrum team. You will have your own specialization, but you will also be able to perform all other tasks within the team.
  • You prioritize your own work together with your team and Product Owner. You will receive immediate feedback from end users and you will have a lot of opportunities to experiment.
  • You will be using the right tools for whatever job will be thrown at you. Choices that were made in the past are not rules.
  • You will work in a motivated team to meet ambitious deadlines. There is always a budget for good ideas.
  • Big data is your guru, your gut feeling isn't. To measure is to know.
  • By actively coaching and continuously providing feedback to team members. 
What we have worked on last quarter
  • Second chance. Giving returned products a second chance by offering them on the website with a discount.
  • High performance authentication system. Customers can now login on the website through a fast NodeJS microservice. 
What a day in the office might look like
You open a pull request in GitHub for your last changes in the Javascript codebase of one of the back-end services for our new faceted-search functionality. You have fixed a bug in a de-serialisation method that was causing metadata to leak from JSON objects. Considering the large amount of simultaneous, relatively small requests these services process, Node.js seemed the obvious choice. So you had to abandon your usual work field of PHP and give the old Javascript another chance. Once again it proved itself a powerful language, capable of building beautiful stuff. Maybe the front-enders were right after all? Now that this has been tackled, you return to PHP. You had this idea to optimise the determination of the sorting order of the filters on the site...

Team
You will be working in a family with three to five other developers, each of them with their own specialization, ranging from PHP to Javascript. Your team will be managed by a Team Lead, a Scrum Master and a Product Owner. You and another team are part of the same family, so you’re both responsible for one specific domain of Coolblue.nl.

Required experience & skills
  • You’re smart and have some way to prove it.
  • Minimum of five years experience as a PHP developer.
  • You're experienced when it comes to improving your colleagues craftsmanship and technical skills.
  • You're able to solve problems using accepted best practices and principles like SOLID and design patterns.
  • You care about code quality.
  • You know how to automate recurring development steps and implement them in continuous integration and deployment systems.
  • Scrum/Agile way of working is almost your second nature.
  • You understand and investigate what a user wants and feels.
  • Experience in working with large codebases and custom frameworks is a plus.
  • Knowledge of Clean (Onion) architecture and PaaS is a plus.
  • Willing to relocate to Rotterdam (or to reasonable daily travel distance).
We offer
  • Money.
  • To help you keep your money, we also chip in on your pension, pay for your travels and offer a discount on all the stuff we sell.
  • Room for you to do things your way.
  • Heartwarming help with the international relocation process from start to finish..
  • Lots of things you can learn through our Coolcademy & skilled sparring partners.
  • 25 days of paid leave, so long as you promise to come back!
  • We like to inspire your passion giving you the opportunity to visit events.
  • An office in the heart of Rotterdam so there's plenty to do when you're not at work.
  • And yes, we also have the industry standard perks such as free beer, ping pong tables, great lunch, team activities and awesome parties.

jobs.title: Machine Learning Engineer
jobs.content:
As a Machine Learning Engineer you use the data of millions of visitors to enable Coolblue to act smarter.

What you tell your friends you do
"I am the fortune teller of Coolblue. After investigating and analysing different data sources, I understand the past and I predict the future."

What you will really be doing
  • Performing complex in-depth analyses by using statistical models.
  • Create new insights, design procedures and smart solutions for the future of the business.
  • Integrating analyses, data and business processes by incorporating the data solutions in our systems.
  • Collaborate with the IT Development team to ensure the correct implementation of algorithms, the creation of new features and the launch of real-time model experiments
  • Proposing improvement initiatives that enable constant improvements at Coolblue.
  • Coaching junior Data Scientists.
  • Advising your team members and colleagues.
How will you be doing this?
  • You are fully aware of the fact that you first need quality data in order to perform optimal analysis, and you know just how to obtain this from various data sources.
  • Provide technical expertise and solutions to Data technologies with a focus on Business Analytics / Business Intelligence.
  • You use this data for analyses and implement this autonomously in the many software systems that Coolblue has at its disposal.
  • Implement machine learning techniques firstly as prototype, to later on implement it in a production environment.
  • You will use the right tools for whatever job will be thrown at you.
  • You experiment with new technologies and ideas and put them to work on your own.
  • You work in multidisciplinary teams and you can easily navigate a quickly expanding organisation.
What we have worked on last quarter
  • We have implemented an online product alternatives done with PySpark. 
  • We have increased the precision and performance of our forecasting procedures by using a Stochastic Gradient Boosting method.
  • Preparing an approach for a daily price-elasticity estimation by product.
  • Internal challenge to predict the user gender using the information generated in a session. 
What a day in the office might look like
This day you’ll have the challenge to improve our weekly sales forecasting models. Of course you make a plan on how to achieve this. You would like to have more knowledge about the current situation. Therefore you need to gather the necessary data from our systems and plot it in such a way that you see the situation in terms of precision. In the afternoon you’ll have a talk with the colleagues who have worked on this problem earlier, but you would like to prepare yourself well for the meeting. You gained a nice idea from the meeting and work this out. Now you can make a prototype to improve the forecast working with only a small sample of the time series, in this case you decide to create a script written in R with your new approach. Nice! You increased the precision of the forecast by 2% in average.  It only pays off when the algorithm is implemented, so therefore you make plans how you are going to do this in the upcoming weeks..

Required experience and skills
  • Preferably university-level degree, MSc. or PhD. in Mathematics, Computer science or Statistics.
  • At least 4 years of relevant business experience in a similar environment (experience only in academia is not enough)
  • Comfortable manipulating and analyzing complex, high-volume, high-dimensional data from varying sources.
  • You have extensive experience in writing scripts in Python and/or R.
  • You have experience with Data mining, SQL, BigQuery, and NoSQL.
  • You have a sound experience in applying Machine Learning techniques like GBM, Random Forest, Elastic-Net, Deep learning and demonstrable experience in applying those techniques (or similar) successfully in a corporate setting.
  • Previous experience with Big Data technologies such as Spark, Hadoop, Cassandra is highly desirable.
  • It is a big plus to have knowledge in at least one of the following languages: Scala, Java, .NET, Delphi, Perl or PHP.
  • Willing to relocate to Rotterdam (or to reasonable daily travel distance).
Other
  • Ability to effectively multi-task and prioritize in an agile team.
  • Analytical thinker, flexible problem solver and team player.
  • Must be an individual with high integrity and strong work ethic
Offer
  • Money.
  • To help you keep your money, we also chip in on your pension, pay for your travels and offer a discount on all the stuff we sell.
  • Room for you to do things your way.
  • Heartwarming help with the international relocation process from start to finish..
  • Lots of things you can learn through our Coolcademy & skilled sparring partners.
  • 25 days of paid leave, so long as you promise to come back!
  • We like to inspire your passion giving you the opportunity to visit events.
  • An office in the heart of Rotterdam so there's plenty to do when you're not at work.
  • And yes, we also have the industry standard perks such as free beer, ping pong tables, great lunch, team activities and awesome parties.

jobs.title: Developer with passion for data
jobs.content:
You will bring your functional programming skills and passion to make sense of all kinds of data to our business intelligence teams.

What you tell your friends you do
"If it needs doing more than once, I automate it. If the data has value, I make it useable."

What we have worked on last quarter
  • Automated a ton of ETL process and deployment pipelines
  • Lots of BigQuery
  • Sent a ton of deprecated systems to the eternal dustbin somewhere
  • Made new logistic and commercial data actionable
Your team
In a few words, we - ask why a lot, automate everything, make data actionable, are willing to help, have a great team, use everything from SQL to Puppet to Python to BigQuery, enjoy our responsibilities. 

Required skills & expertise 
  • You ask why and then why and again why before tackling a problem.
  • You know how to get your development machine up and running - we love Darwin and Linux - we hope you do too :).
  • You have plenty experience with functional programming - we love Python.
  • You know how to chat up any database and get what you want - we flirt with SQL Server and BigQuery.
  • Before you asked, you checked Google and Stackoverflow.
  • Whether it’s Vim or Emacs knock yourself out we love to Bash zsh.
  • Spaces not tabs unless it’s Go - not the Pokemon variant.
  • The cloud is just someone else’s computer, it’s great when they manage stuff for us, and otherwise it’s just another place to have your container settle down and replicate.
  • Data, data, data and not the pale android.
  • You know how to get your code to production - continuously within in every sprint - some words that describe us: Git, TeamCity, Puppet, RESTful, API, you get the gist...
  • You are not scared to deploy awesome features on Friday, and know when you sleep in on Saturday all is well.
  • Bonus points if you have Untappd, like eating Chinese food Friday lunchtime and you want to work opposite the coolest and shiniest kapsalonbakje in Holland.
  • Kudos if you can beat us at the pooltable.
We offer
  • Money. And we'll ask the government to give you a tax break.
  • Relocation assistance, from start to finish. 
  • Dutch language courses. To help you become a Rotterdammert.
  • Over 30 courses at our Coolblue University.
  • A relocation bonus on top of your first monthly salary. 
  • Discount on a new bicycle. Because that's how we roll.
  • A 10% discount on all of our products. 
  • Travel allowance and a retirement plan.
  • An office at the best possible location. It's only a hop and a skip away from Rotterdam Central Station. Or a 2-minute walk. 
  • An awesome workplace. With freshly prepared meals, monthly TGIF drinks at our own bar, epic Coolblue parties, extracurricular activities, and an informal, playful office space.
  • 25 leave days. As long as you'll promise to come back. 
  • Parties. All night LAN.

  • You prioritize your own work together with your team and Product Owner. You will receive immediate feedback from end users and you will have a lot of opportunities to experiment.
  • You will be using the right tools for whatever job will be thrown at you. Choices that were made in the past are not rules.
  • You will work in a motivated team to meet ambitious deadlines. There is always a budget for good ideas.
  • Big data is your guru, your gut feeling isn't. To measure is to know.
  • By actively coaching and continuously providing feedback to team members. 
What we have worked on last quarter
  • Second chance. Giving returned products a second chance by offering them on the website with a discount.
  • High performance authentication system. Customers can now login on the website through a fast NodeJS microservice. 
What a day in the office might look like
You open a pull request in GitHub for your last changes in the Javascript codebase of one of the back-end services for our new faceted-search functionality. You have fixed a bug in a de-serialisation method that was causing metadata to leak from JSON objects. Considering the large amount of simultaneous, relatively small requests these services process, Node.js seemed the obvious choice. So you had to abandon your usual work field of PHP and give the old Javascript another chance. Once again it proved itself a powerful language, capable of building beautiful stuff. Maybe the front-enders were right after all? Now that this has been tackled, you return to PHP. You had this idea to optimise the determination of the sorting order of the filters on the site...

Team
You will be working in a family with three to five other developers, each of them with their own specialization, ranging from PHP to Javascript. Your team will be managed by a Team Lead, a Scrum Master and a Product Owner. You and another team are part of the same family, so you’re both responsible for one specific domain of Coolblue.nl.

Required experience & skills
  • You’re smart and have some way to prove it.
  • Minimum of five years experience as a PHP developer.
  • You're experienced when it comes to improving your colleagues craftsmanship and technical skills.
  • You're able to solve problems using accepted best practices and principles like SOLID and design patterns.
  • You care about code quality.
  • You know how to automate recurring development steps and implement them in continuous integration and deployment systems.
  • Scrum/Agile way of working is almost your second nature.
  • You understand and investigate what a user wants and feels.
  • Experience in working with large codebases and custom frameworks is a plus.
  • Knowledge of Clean (Onion) architecture and PaaS is a plus.
  • Willing to relocate to Rotterdam (or to reasonable daily travel distance).
We offer
  • Money.
  • To help you keep your money, we also chip in on your pension, pay for your travels and offer a discount on all the stuff we sell.
  • Room for you to do things your way.
  • Heartwarming help with the international relocation process from start to finish..
  • Lots of things you can learn through our Coolcademy & skilled sparring partners.
  • 25 days of paid leave, so long as you promise to come back!
  • We like to inspire your passion giving you the opportunity to visit events.
  • An office in the heart of Rotterdam so there's plenty to do when you're not at work.
  • And yes, we also have the industry standard perks such as free beer, ping pong tables, great lunch, team activities and awesome parties.

jobs.content:
Software Development Engineer in Test (SDET)


The Gogo Platform and Services group is building a team of talented Software Quality Engineers to help us on our mission towards continuous integration and then deployment. If you are a test engineer with strong development skills, ideally Java, who loves to build test automation then this is the role for you.


You are an expert in cross-platform web application testing creating and using highly automated test frameworks. You've successfully built automation frameworks for desktop and mobile applications using open source technologies like Selenium Webdriver, TestNG, and programming skills in Java, Python, Ruby etc. In addition to systems analysis to support quality engineering you will get to work alongside the developers and bring best in class automation to the company. You will also work alongside our platform tooling team who will be building our cloud platform and support them with our deployment automation tooling. Roles and Responsibilities:



  • Perform systems analysis and collaborate with engineers across teams to build best in class testing approach and automation frameworks to support continuous integration and help improve testing and the quality of our code.

  • Continuously help raise the bar – finding new paths and technologies

  • Help design and implement load and performance testing

  • Verify that database data match an expected set of values

  • Support Root Cause Analyses

  • Training and mentoring of other team members as we adopt more automation.

  • Build test automation framework to develop, maintain and continuously evolve efficient test automation approach for full coverage.

  • Collaborate with development engineers to improve testing and the quality of our code.

  • Continuously help raise the bar – help us find new paths and technologies to be best in class.

  • Coordinate testing efforts with extended teams within the enterprise.

  • Help with the training and mentoring of other team members as needed.

jobs.title: Sr. Java Engineer- Cloud Services
jobs.content:
Sr. Java Engineer - Cloud Services


This position is for a Sr. Cloud Services Java Developer who will help us develop our next gen airline services platform and also assist in migrating our legacy J2EE applications to the cloud. We will be leveraging Amazon Web Services with plans to integrate some exciting open source technologies such as NetflixOSS and Spring Cloud.


The ideal candidate for this role would have experience and passion for building horizontally scalable Java based microservices. You will have good experience building microservices using JAX-RS, Spring boot or Dropwizard. You will also have considerable experience in SOAP using Apache Axis or Apache CXF to support the migration of our legacy J2EE applications.


This role requires strong Java 7 or 8 knowledge and excellent understanding of deploying microservices on various application servers/servlet containers.


Key responsibilities:



  • Develop AWS based micro services solutions.

  • Maintain and assist in migration of Gogo's legacy J2EE applications.

  • Ensure unit tests are well written to provide maximum code coverage.

  • Assist with performance tuning of the built services.


Required Skills & Experience



  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related discipline, or equivalent experience.

  • In-depth development experience with Java/J2EE.

  • Web Services, Web APIs, and microservices: JAX-RS, Spring Boot, DropWizard, JSON, Web-Sockets.

  • Solid experience with SQL and NoSQL based solutions.

  • Must have experience consuming SOAP and producing RESTful services.


Bonus Skills & Experience



  • Reactive programming using tools likes RxJava or Akka.

  • Netflix OSS tools such as Zuul, Eureka, Hysterix, or equivalents.

  • Cloud deployments, containers, and continuous integration – Jenkins, AWS code deploy etc.

  • Experience working in a DevOps environment.


Gogo's worldwide inflight Wi-Fi services have made internet and video entertainment a regular part of flying. We are a diverse group of technologists, marketers, strategists, and any other function you can think of- all working together in extraordinary harmony. And that's just the beginning.


We connect the aviation industry and its travelers with innovative technology and applications, and we do it all in a high-energy environment that welcomes the next challenge. Be prepared for a dynamic ride with people who are passionate about what they're building. Gogo?is an equal opportunity employer and works in compliance with both federal and state laws. jobs.title: Senior Medical Advisor, Product Performance
jobs.content:
Abbott is a global healthcare company devoted to improving life through the development of products and technologies that span the breadth of healthcare. With a portfolio of leading, science-based offerings in diagnostics, medical devices, nutritionals and branded generic pharmaceuticals, Abbott serves people in more than 150 countries and employs approximately 73,000 people. Please note that candidates need to be eligible to work in the U.S. without Abbott sponsorship.

JOB DESCRIPTION:

Primary Job Function:

Provide direction to ensure development of a strategy for the divisions medical oversight product performance function. Provide input and oversight for product and clinical product performance functions including monitoring of product safety related items (i.e. complaints, MDRs), reporting, evaluation, and Health Hazard Evaluations and safety in clinical study design.

Advisor appointment that determines how the business maintains focus on product safety, for on-market products across the Coronary, Endovascular and Structural Heart business units.

Under the supervision of the Director, Medical Affairs, and DVP of Medical Affairs and Product Performance, provides direction in establishing and implementing required product safety processes and procedures for new products and technologies as clinical studies are implemented, worldwide regulatory approvals are obtained and new products are commercialized. Has responsibilities that include divisions new products in the Structural Heart business unit and current the product MItraClip.

Serve as an advisor to the Medical Science and Professional Education groups within this department, as required.

30029243 Senior Medical Advisor, Product Performance (Open)Medical Education and Training.

Failure to effectively execute and perform in this role may result in removal of vascular products from market. Depending upon product impacted, could negatively impact up to $400MM in revenue in a given year.

Core Job Responsibilities:

Responsible for compliance with applicable Corporate and Divisional Policies and procedures.

¬∑ Under Director and DVP oversight, provide medical oversight for on-market product and product performance functions, including monitoring of product safety related items (i.e. complaints, MDRs), reporting, evaluation, and Health Hazard Evaluations and safety in clinical study design.

¬∑ Reviews and evaluates product performance data and trends to provide early identification of issues related to product performance or usage concerns in order to minimize clinical safety risk. This includes designing changes to product performance assessment and management to improve ongoing monitoring and risk assessment.

¬∑ Makes appropriate product and procedural recommendations, and works closely with doctor/patient related issues for the safety of drug eluting stents, coronary, endovascular and structural heart and clinical study activities.

¬∑ Provide training for the Product Performance group. Works cross functionally with division Compliance, Clinical Science, Regulatory Affairs, and Commercial organizations as required. Requires involvement with all on-market product performance, clinical product performance, compliance, clinical, clinical science, medical information, scientific, and regulatory groups within Abbott Vascular and Abbott.

¬∑ Interact with internal compliance organization, FDA and/or international regulatory bodies, as required, in response to product performance inquiries and clinical study product performance matters, to enhance business growth opportunities for Abbott.

Provides medical support to the Office of the Chief Medical Officer that includes representing the Division at Medical Conferences, Sales Meetings and Physician/Hospital interactions, as required by the DVP or CMO.

jobs.title: PHP Web Developer
jobs.content:
PHP Web Developer required £39,924 - £42,742 + 32d Hol + 8 bank holidays + Health & Life cover + many other benefits

Birmingham City University (BCU) is a large, diverse and increasingly popular place to study. They are defined by their core values of "Excellence, People focus, Partnership working and Fairness & Integrity".

The 22,500 students are at the heart of everything they do. They are from over 80 countries and can access an enviable range of facilities with even more planned. The Complete University Guide ranked BCU as top 30 UK University for spending on facilities in 2015.

They are in the midst of transformation. BCU is investing £260 million in its estate including a major expansion of the city centre campus at Eastside adjacent to the planned HS2 Curzon Street station. This provides opportunities to make substantial fundamental changes to our learning environment and operations.
An opportunity has arisen for a proven PHP Web Developer to join a busy in house Development team. If successful, you will be joining a multi-disciplined software development team consisting of backend integrators, web developers, web designers, development DBAs and the QA testers.

Essential Skills:

* 3 years backend PHP experience
* 3 years mySQL experience
* Able to configure apache web servers for hosting of web sites, apps, open source CMSs such as Wordpress
* 3 years front end development experience in JavaScript
* 2 years experience of using jQuery
* 3 years design experience in Photoshop or Fireworks
* Use of source control repositories such as GIT, SVN or TFS.
* Experience of Moodle VLE
* Experience of configuring and developing WordPress

Desirable skills:

* Able to create conceptual designs and take through wireframing & mocking to working pages and UAT.
* Any exposure to ASP.NET and C# or VB.NET would be highly advantageous.
* Experience in Agile/Scrum development methodologies.

As this is a friendly and collaborative team with a positive culture you will need to have good interpersonal skills and have a good standard of written and verbal communication.

The role demands someone who is naturally interested and in-touch with the latest web technologies. You will be confident in communicating at all levels and will be passionate about knowledge sharing to enhance the overall quality of the team. Experience in e-learning environments is an advantage but not essential.

This exciting position is paying a good salary and a very attractive benefits package including 32 days Holiday plus 8 bank holidays, Career Average Pension, sickness & absence entitlement, Private Health, On site gym, Life Assurance, Travel card Scheme, Car parking, Cycle to work scheme, car share scheme and catering.

The immediate location for this role will be North Birmingham with later relocation near to the City Centre scheduled for later on in the year. The post holder will be required to travel between Birmingham sites as per operational requirements.

If you are ready for this challenge and have the necessary experience please submit an up to date copy of your CV outlining your relevant skills and experience, together with your notice period/availability or call Daney on 0121 230 1455.

jobs.title: Infrastructure Engineer
jobs.content:
We are looking for an Infrastructure Engineer (full-time) to start immediately in our Berlin office, Germany.


With up to 120,000 downloads per day and more than 9,000 hours of language learning content, Babbel is the market leading online-learning app.


Our AWS-based infrastructure is serving more than 20.000 requests per minute to users worldwide via different clients (Android, iOS, Web) while expanding on a global scale.


Our infrastructure team takes care of the key pillars of our AWS-based microservice architecture and provides help and guidelines for other feature teams to enable them to deliver and move fast independently.


If you are passionate about building simple, secure, stable, AWS-based microservice platforms that support scaling and continuous scaling - we would love to hear from you!


Responsibilities



  • Build and run a sustainable, scaleable automated infrastructure (Chef, OpsWorks, CI, Monitoring etc.) for our AWS-based microservice architecture

  • Improve our continuous integration and introduce continuous deployment pipeline

  • Focus on platform security

  • Support & enable the other feature development teams

  • Help establish DevOps practices throughout the engineering teams


Requirements



  • deep experience in building complex web applications based on AWS services

  • 3+ years experience in programming and architecting large-scale applications

  • experience in building microservice-based infrastructure setups including monitoring

  • experience in infrastructure automation (Chef, OpsWorks)

  • experience in infrastructure Provisioning (Terraform, CloudFormation, Chef Provisioning, or else)

  • passionate about implementing simple solutions for complex problems

  • driven to multiply knowledge and educate teams about DevOps practices

  • quality oriented and detailed focused

  • can-do attitude and strong team player

  • BONUS: Experience in Ruby on Rails

  • BONUS: Experience in monitoring and metrics tools

  • BONUS: Experience in agile methodologies (Scrum, Kanban)

  • BONUS: Willingness to engage in on-call shifts


Benefits



  • Tackle high volume, scaleable problems with a cloud-based setup and latest cutting-edge technologies

  • The potential to change the way of learning for millions of users worldwide

  • Responsibility from day one and professional and personal growth

  • Potential within a fast growing team

  • Participate in hackdays, technology brown-bags

  • Open source contributions

  • A lively startup atmosphere with friendly working hours

  • Long-term prospects

  • A vibrant international team from over 36 different nationalities

  • Excellent working conditions with a location in the heart of the Berlin scene

  • Great company benefits (High-End company bike, fresh fruits & drinks, language courses)


Check out our jobs page, our blog and our techblog to get an impression of how we work at Babbel!

jobs.title: Senior Polyglot Software Engineer(Ruby/JavaScript)
jobs.content:
We are looking for an experienced Senior Polyglot Software Engineer(Ruby/JavaScript) (full-time) to start immediately in our office in Berlin, Germany.


Who we are


With millions of regular users and more than 9,000 hours of premium content, Babbel.com is growing fast while shaping the future of learning. We defined the market for online language learning, and today our product is available worldwide across multiple platforms. Now, we’re about to embark on an exciting new journey to change the way people learn languages.


How we work


You’ll be working in a small team that is focused on building new products and offerings for our learners. This involves creating both quick prototypes to assess ideas as well as building new products from scratch and supporting their growth throughout their lifecycle.


Who are we looking for


You are a passionate Senior Full-Stack (Polyglot) Software Engineer with a broad technology expertise who loves to develop great products. You are a generalist who knows what architecture, language or framework is the right one to use.  You have an eye for details and enjoy working in a fast-moving and diverse company. You make your environment one where everyone shares the goal of delivering outstanding product increments to customers – as quickly as possible.


Responsibilities for the role:



  • Build prototypes as well as bring them to production

  • Takeover code ownership and operational responsibility

  • Collaborate with other disciplines, in and across teams, to ensure a seamless user experience


Requirements:



  • Gets things done

  • 3+ years experience building web applications with Ruby

  • Good understanding of Javascript as a language and best practices

  • Experience in at least one Frontend and one Backend technology/framework

  • Good knowledge in both SQL and NoSQL databases, data modeling, data representation and API design

  • Experience in implementing user interfaces working across device capabilities & screen sizes

  • Experience with product development in an agile environment from concept to maintenance

  • Plus: Experience with Ruby web frameworks (Ruby on Rails or Sinatra)

  • Plus: Experience with Python, Erlang or Go

  • Plus: Experience with AWS services (Dynamodb, API Gateway, Lambda, IAM, Opsworks, …)

  • Plus: DevOps and automatization knowledge, e.g. Chef, Puppet, Vagrant or Docker

  • Plus: Eye for design and usability details


Benefits:



  • Be an essential part of building an exciting product and take important architectural and technological decisions

  • The potential to change how millions of users worldwide learn languages

  • Responsibility from day one and professional and personal growth

  • A vibrant international team from over 36 different nationalities

  • Participate in hackdays, technology brown-bags

  • A lively startup atmosphere with friendly working hours

  • Long-term prospects

  • Excellent working conditions with a location in the heart of the Berlin scene

  • Great company benefits (high-end company bike, free fresh fruits & drinks, etc.)

jobs.title: Scrum Master
jobs.content:
Job Description

15+ years ago, priceline.com transformed the travel space. ¬†Now, we are building a new team to transform how we work and how we develop products. We are looking for a Scrum Master to implement our Agile & Scrum practices and help teams evolve their development processes. The ideal candidate will bring deep experience and a collaborative attitude. She/He will utilize the Agile/Scrum process to enable us to increase velocity, increase visibility, and improve quality throughout our organization. ¬†This position will lead teams at varied levels of maturity. ¬†Our group is poised to drive dramatic change within the organization so a¬†successful candidate must be hungry to learn and hungry to teach.¬†

Responsibilities

  • Act as a mentor to ensure¬†development teams work toward core the Scrum principles of collaboration, prioritization, team accountability, and visibility
  • Coordinate scrum rituals: stand-ups,¬†backlog grooming, estimation, sprint and release planning, demos, and scrum-of-scrums, and retrospectives
  • Monitor and communicate key Agile performance metrics:¬†burn-down, burn-up, cumulative flow, velocity
  • Train development teams in all aspects of the standard Agile/Scrum process
  • Engage stakeholders to ensure alignment, visibility, and transparency
  • Foster a collaborative,¬†cross-functional environment in which to build great products, solve customer needs, and continuously improve
  • Manage projects in JIRA and Confluence¬†and drive the development and maintenance of tools, measurement, and best practices within the company.

Detailed Qualifications

  • Proficiency with Lean Agile methodology and the¬†Scrum software development methodology, values, and procedures
  • 3+ years of experience as a Scrum Master or Agile Project Manager¬†for multiple software development teams, supporting¬†Lean methodologies and¬†practices like iteration planning, release planning, prototyping,¬†retrospectives, continuous delivery, and behavior-driven development
  • Deep with JIRA, Confluence, and the rest of the Atlassian suite and using¬†JIRA's Agile performance metrics to drive accountability and continuous improvement
  • Have used Atlassian's toolset to foster¬†fostering organizational changes and¬†implement agile processes throughout multiple disciplines (software development, QA, marketing, networking, devops, customer service, help-desk) and industries.¬†
  • A belief that Agile fosters open team communication, transparency, and the ability to make honest project decisions
  • A belief that Agile¬†enables individuals to more fully understand, participate, and engage in business objectives
  • A deep understanding of MVP and the ability to guide¬†priceline.com¬†through the pitfalls of process versus flexibility
  • Experience managing software development efforts for large scale web applications using Agile and Lean methodologies with in-house and outsourced teams.
  • Ability to understand technical issues at a intermediate to high level.
  • Comfortable working with geographically distributed teams (off-site team members and local team members).
  • One or more Agile certifications (e.g., CSM, CSPO, CSP, PSM, PSPO). SAFe certifications (SA, SP, SPC) is a plus

General Qualifications

  • Bachelor's degree in¬†computer science, engineering, or a related discipline
  • Masters degree in computer science or related discipline is a plus

What does success look like?

  • The cycle time of your teams will decrease (and quality will increase).
  • Product deliveries and performance will be predictable and thoroughly understood by stakeholders.
  • Your internal customers will consider you a strategic partner.
  • Your stakeholders and team will see you as an invaluable resource in their day-to-day work.
  • Your peers will view you as a teacher and someone who emotionally evangelizes Agile methodologies.

Specialties: Agile, Scrum, Lean/Agile, Team Building,¬†Agile Coaching and Scaled Agile Framework, Minimum Viable Product, Atlassian JIRA / Confluence / Agile / Service Desk

jobs.title: Associate Android Developer
jobs.content:
Priceline.com's team was awarded a Top Developer badge on Google Play!¬†Come join us and be a part of our high-performing engineering team!¬†

Priceline is looking for optimistic and collaborative, developers to roll up their sleeves and join our mobile team. We believe in hiring people who love what they do. Are you passionate about Android, mobile technology, and building great products? If so, we want to hear from you!

As a member of our Android Development Team, you'll be building priceline.com's world-class Android app for booking hotels, rental cars, and air travel. You will work closely with Product Managers and UI/UX specialists to create fast, efficient, stable code, with core Android technologies such as: Content Providers, Sync Adapters, View Animations, Property Animations, JSON, and more. Additionally, you'll be implementing A/B tests and real-time analytics, as a member of a tight-knit, fast-moving team that includes server-side developers.

Required Skills:
Demonstrated experience creating one or more production-quality Android apps using Android Studio: Send us your Google Play links if you have em!¬†

Strong fluency of the Java programming language, the Android SDK (versions 4.1 and up), Dalvik VM, RenderScript, memory management, strong command of object oriented principles, data structure optimizations, security, IPC, third party service integration (e.g. Google Play Services) and the Android development environment.¬†

Experience as a member of a development team that uses Agile development techniques.

Thorough understanding of REST-ful API design: You can design and document a client-server protocol, and you can implement the client side of a documented protocol.

Required Experience:

  • Bachelor's Degree in related field
  • Strong coding abilities and experience with Java and Android SDK (version 4.1 and up)
  • Strong experience with Object Oriented (OO) software design
  • Experience understanding large and complex code bases
  • Memory Management (as it relates to Android devices)
  • Multi-Threading
  • Caching Mechanisms
  • Integration with Google Play Services
  • Implementing REST APIs

jobs.title: Agile Coach
jobs.content:
15+ years ago, priceline.com transformed the travel space. We are now looking for some to work with us to transform how we continue to do that. We are looking for an Agile Coach to deliver consistency and¬†accelerate¬†our Agile & Scrum practices and mentor process change throughout the organization. The ideal candidate will bring deep experience and a collaborative attitude to enable us to increase velocity, improve visibility, and raise quality throughout our organization. ¬†This position will coach teams at different levels of maturity -- across disparate programs and development teams. ¬†Our group is poised to drive dramatic change within the organization, a¬†successful candidate must be hungry to learn and hungry to teach.¬†

Responsibilities

  • Work with stakeholders at all levels to be an evangelist and catalyst for our adoption and roll-out of agile methodologies:¬†ceremonies, practices, and values.
  • Articulate the business value of Agile Practices (i.e. answer the question why do we do it this way)
  • Serve as a thought leader to evangelize Agile and industry best practices
  • Establish a coalition of supporters to help drive¬†awareness of Agile processes and Atlassian's software solutions
  • Analyze our current processes, prioritize areas for improvement, and work alongside teams to implement change
  • Manage projects in JIRA and Confluence to¬†ensure stakeholder-appropriate visibility into project status,¬†including the Senior Leadership Team.
  • Monitor and report on key Agile performance metrics
  • Develop and deliver trainings on Agile processes/best-practices and Atlassian software for internal customers (including new hires) of varied levels throughout priceline.com so that everyone sees benefits from Agile and to foster Agile leads who can manage high-performing teams
  • Mentor team members:¬†defining and manage product scope, objectives, milestones, roles and accountabilities, deliverables and approach, and backlog management,¬†Agile rituals, reporting, MVP definition, validated learning, test-driven development, and conflict resolution
  • Function as Scrum Master or manage Scrum of Scrums, depending on need
  • Actively communicate with project / program stakeholders to¬†ensure alignment, visibility, and transparency into all aspects of assigned projects and programs.¬†
  • Above all else, foster and model a collaborative,¬†cross-functional¬†team environment that's driven to build great products and¬†solve customer-needs and enterprise goals.

Detailed Qualifications

  • A belief that Agile enables individuals to more fully understand, participate, and engage in business objectives.
  • A belief that Agile fosters open team communication, transparency, and the ability to make honest trade-offs in project decisions.
  • A deep understanding of MVP and the ability to guide¬†priceline.com¬†through the pitfalls of process versus flexibility
  • Proficiency with Scrum processes, Lean Agile methodology, JIRA, Confluence, and the rest of the Atlassian suite
  • Experience driving change across companies or industries and¬†deep experience developing teams and helping to align team objectives with business goals
  • Experience using JIRA's Agile performance metrics to drive accountability and continuous improvement
  • 1-2 years of experience supporting and teaching Lean methodologies and¬†practices like Iteration Planning, Prototyping, Release Planning, Retrospectives, Writing User Stories and Acceptance Criteria, Velocity-based Planning, Continuous Delivery, Behavior-Driven Development
  • Empathy and an exceptional bedside manner are essential in gaining alignment and excitement around Agile processes
  • Experience managing software development efforts for large scale web applications using Agile and Lean methodologies with in-house and outsourced teams.
  • The ideal candidate has mentored companies that are transitioning to Agile, Scrum, or the "Lean Startup" method.
  • The ideal candidate has used Atlassian's toolset to foster¬†fostering organizational changes and¬†implement agile processes throughout multiple disciplines (software development, QA, marketing, networking, devops, customer service, help-desk) and industries.¬†
  • The ideal candidate will possess a deep understanding of Agile PLM technologies, as well as very strong conceptual, analytical, judgment and communication abilities, including with nontechnical audiences.

General Qualifications

  • 2+ years of experience as a Scrum Master / Agile Project Manager
  • Bachelor's degree in¬†computer science, engineering, or a related discipline
  • PLUS:¬†Masters degree in computer science or related discipline
  • PLUS:¬†one or more Agile certifications (e.g., CSM, CSPO, CSP, PSM, PSPO). SAFe certifications (SA, SP, SPC) highly desirable.\

jobs.title: Front End Developer
jobs.content:
Priceline.com, the leading online destination for smart travelers, is seeking an intelligent, motivated full-time front end developer to join our growing team.  Our creative, flexible company culture merges the agility of a start-up with the stability of an established, international public company.

The ideal candidate is passionate about creating well-architected solutions; well-versed in the latest web technologies, such as SASS, node.js, AngularJS, and NoSQL; comfortable with distributed version control; and fluent in current best practices for responsive and accessible design. 

Our agile development process centers around A/B testing incremental changes and empowering our technologists to suggest best practices. We understand the dynamic nature of front-end technology, and we support our developers’ efforts to stay on the leading edge by attending meet-ups, going to conferences, and educating one another through code reviews and presentations. 

What You’ll Do:

You’ll be working in a small, tight-knit team, supporting our high-traffic Hotel, Airline, Rental Car and Vacation Package businesses, building applications that deliver real value to our customers.

You’ll be working closely with Product and Design team members on a modern technology stack grounded in node.js, with an MVC-based javascript framework (currently AngularJS) delivering data from our REST-based APIs. You will be optimizing our sites for cross-device performance, including mobile, desktop, tablets and phablets, with an emphasis on time to start render.

Your Skills Include:

* JavaScript

* At least one modern MVC-based JavaScript framework (Angular, Ember, Backbone, Knockout)

* node.js

* REST-ful API design; Spring framework a plus

* HTML5

* CSS (SASS/Compass a plus)

* Git

* A collaborative work ethic and the ability to work within a self-organized, cross functional team

* Familiarity with agile techniques

* Great communication skills

* Familiar with web server-side technologies, such as JSP, PHP, Ruby or Python

* Previous startup experience

* A degree in computer science or equivalent work experience

Required experience:

Associate Front End Engineer: 1-2 years’ experience or equivalent proficiency with the skills outlined above

Front End Engineer: 3-5 years’ experience or equivalent proficiency with the skills outlined above

Senior Front End Engineer: 5+ years’ experience or equivalent proficiency with the skills outlined above

jobs.title: Analyst, International Division
jobs.content:
About The Role

Generalist role to support Country Heads in SoFi‚Äôs international expansion efforts. Primary responsibilities will include conducting general market research, compiling preliminary budgets and assisting in general corporate and operational activities. The role will liaise between various functional groups including marketing, product, legal, credit and loan operations. The position will be a key contributor to SoFi‚Äôs international expansion plans, a critical pillar of SoFi‚Äôs overall growth plans

By joining SoFi, you‚Äôll become part of a forward-thinking company that is transforming financial services. Recently ranked as one of the fastest growing FinTech companies in the country, we‚Äôre nearly 650 employees strong. We offer the excitement of a rapidly growing startup with the stability of a seasoned management team

Responsibilities

Market research

  • Total addressable market analysis
  • Competitive landscape assessment
  • Preliminary product-market fit analysis

Budgeting and financial planning and analysis

Corporate support

  • Preparation of compliance policies and training programs

  • Development of Operational servicing

Qualifications

  • Motivated, self-starter with the ability to effectively manage multiple deliverables under tight deadlines
  • Able to combine strategic thinking with tactical execution
  • BA/BS required

Benefits

  • Catered lunches, a fully stocked kitchen, and subsidized gym membership.
  • Competitive salary packages and bonuses.
  • A flexible vacation policy allows you to truly relax and reboot.
  • Comprehensive health, vision, dental, and life insurance as well as disability benefits.
  • 100% of health, vision, and dental premiums paid by SoFI for employees and their dependents.
  • 401(k) and education on retirement planning. ‚Ä®
  • Tuition reimbursement on approved programs, up to $5,250 a year.
  • Monthly contribution to help you pay off your student loans.

jobs.title: C++ Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Flow Traders is a leading principal trading firm with Headquarters in Amsterdam, and offices worldwide in New York, Singapore and Cluj, Romania.


We are looking for a talented C++ Software Engineer to join our Trading Engines development team. The Software engineer will be working closely with the other engineers and our traders to develop and improve the proprietary trading platform that enable Flow Traders to trade on exchanges worldwide.


What will you work on?  



  • Design and development of complex, highly scalable and latency-optimized business critical trading software

  • New tools development as well as improving, maintaining and supporting existing applications

  • Translating the business requirements and ideas into software products 


Requirements



  • BSc or MSc in Computing Science or equivalent

  • A Minimum of 5 years working experience as a Software engineer in C++

  • Experience in addressing extreme non-functional requirements related to latencies and scalability

  • Demonstrable competitive nature and winner's mentality, e.g. through winning Mathematics Olympiads, Chess tournaments

  • Ability to write clean, reliable and highly scalable code

  • Working experience in an environment that develops their own product (not necessarily finance-related)

  • Ability to liaise both with highly-technical colleagues as well as traders and other non-technical personnel


We offer


Flow Traders offers you an exciting job and lots of opportunities within the most dynamic of environments with an excellent compensation package. We like to think that talent grows at Flow and stays at Flow. To ensure this, we provide our employees with the best working environment, the latest technology, continuous support, and we go out of our way to retain the small business feeling with which we started. We offer a competitive salary and reserve a percentage of our business results for our bonus pool.

jobs.title: Be part of a growing team building SDN Solutions with Arista Networks
jobs.content:
As a C++ Software Engineer your core responsibility is to deliver new product features. A major part of this is writing and owning the code that drives our products. But the role of a C++ Software Engineer is much bigger than ‘simply’ writing code. Software Engineers work on the whole development process, including:




  • suggesting and deciding what features to build




  • driving the design




  • writing the code (of course)




  • pushing, testing, documenting the feature




Engineering Driven. Our engineers have full ownership of their projects. Our management structure is flat and lightweight. Software engineering is run by software engineers -- you are in charge of delivering your work from design to code to test to customer shipment.   


Insane amount of automation! We put a premium on building and using tools that make everyone super-productive. This translates into quicker turnaround times on new features and products for increased revenue with smaller teams.   


We value openness. No part of the company is off-limits, meaning that our engineers have the chance to work on a variety of different areas. Our interns have the same responsibility as our full timers who have the same responsibility as our old timers and all get to work side-by-side on important, customer-impacting projects.

We are looking for someone with a blend of technical and people leadership. Someone with a sharp aptitude for the latest trends in the front-end space, passion for building products that are a pleasure to use, and fondness for guiding teams to success while fostering personal growth of every individual on the team.

jobs.title: C++ Software Engineer
jobs.content:
We're seeking exceptional C++ Software Engineers to join our growing research and development center in Melbourne.


 IRESS is a principal global supplier of share market and wealth management systems producing innovative, sophisticated solutions. We provide solutions that help with life's big decisions – from getting a mortgage approval, planning for retirement, to trading on the stock exchange – things that make a real difference to people's lives and financial wellbeing.


Role


As a C++ Software Engineer you'll have a big impact in ensuring continuous innovation and development of IRESS Financial Market products throughout the entire development lifecycle from inception to deployment and production support. You'll play in a key role in building complex, high performance, multithreaded trading applications used by leading financial institutions in several countries, handling over 10,000 transactions per second!


With over 100+ Software Engineers in our Melbourne office, as we continue to grow there's opportunities to develop your skills by working on different products, taking on additional responsibilities in projects, mentoring or becoming an expert on IRESS products.


As a C++ Software Engineer you'll also have the opportunity to join a highly collaborative, AGILE team. We're passionate about improvement as we introduce continuous integration and continuous delivery best practices into our engineering environment.  You'll work alongside talented Engineers who are passionate about keeping up to date with the latest trends and tools whilst having access to formal training opportunities at IRESS.


We're currently looking for Software Engineers across all levels from Junior to Senior. This is a great chance for a C++ Software Engineer to solve unique problems at one of Australia's fastest growing and established Fintech's!


About You


Required



  • Experience in a similar role as Software Engineer, Developer, Programmer etc.

  • Strong knowledge in C++, n-tier architecture and SQL.

  • Strong design, development and collaboration skills gained in developing software product solutions

  • Experience working in a result-oriented culture

  • Effective communication and collaboration skills both written and verbal

  • A strong aptitude, creativity and appetite to work on and solve complex problems


Desired



  • Solid experience working in complex and innovative R&D environments

  • Experience working in AGILE teams

  • Experience with real time, multithreaded, time critical applications

  • .Net and Python experience

  • Bachelor Degree in Computer Science or equivalent

jobs.title: Web Development Lead
jobs.content:
We have an exciting opportunity for a creative and skilled individual to join us as the Web Development Lead of our newly formed web team.  Join a passionate and talented group, creating market leading, experience driven web sites and services that market our products and services around the globe.


About the role


In this role you will be responsible for leading development of our customer facing web properties.  This role is not just about building sites.  It's about creating beautiful, engaging and responsive experiences that customers want to come back to.  It's about delivering platforms that can scale to meet the needs of a global organisation, efficiently supporting the dynamic content demands of such a business, marketing our products, educating our customers and empowering our sales force.


 You will have a sound foundation in web development, be familiar with modern web technologies and practises, and have experience working with large scale CMS systems.  You will be comfortable working with cross-functional teams to deliver effective solutions.


 You will be someone who is passionate about what they create, who values good design (both visual and architectural).  You will be someone who seeks to engage your customers both internal and external, understanding their language and not just delivering technology, but making technology work for them.


 You will be working with external development teams, so experience managing web projects is beneficial.  You enjoy the challenge of establishing a strategy to deliver solutions that meet the current need but have the capability to evolve to meet future needs.   You will have a professional approach understanding the importance of well planned, structured, tested and documented projects. 


 We look for people who are real team players, working within an agile development environment to produce innovative, world class solutions.  You will be involved with the design process from understanding user needs all the way through to delivering the product.


 Company and culture


We offer exceptional benefits and a commitment to developing and motivating our employees.  You will gain valuable experience working in the medical device industry and provide solutions that really do change lives.


Work in an environment where software services play a critical role in the success of our fast growing, successful business. Apply now!  


About the Company 


Applicants may be required to complete relevant background checks as part of the recruitment process for this role, this may include criminal and credit checks.


Applications for this position close Wednesday 12th October 2016

jobs.title: Care Coach - Spanish Bilingual
jobs.content:
racking CodeCRCCHSPBKRSFDCA1162Job Description

Help others live well, as a Care Coach.



Are you serious about health and wellness?


Do you enjoy working on a team and helping others?



As a Care Coach, you will facilitate patient engagement and motivate patients to achieve their health and wellness goals.



What does a Care Coach do?



  • Collaborate with pharmacists to support patient needs.

  • Demo

  • Help identify and overcome barriers to the attainment of health and wellness goals previously identified by the patient's physician. These barriers often include controllable factors such as smoking cessation, disease education and weight loss.

  • Help develop a personalized care plan, which is shared with the patient's referring physician.

  • Provide patients with integrated care, by collaborating with clinical staff made up of Pharmacists and Registered Nurses.

  • Help patients through improved health status, personalized wellness support and improved health literacy and better quality of life.

  • Establish positive coaching and mentoring relationships with patients.



Are you a Care Coach?



  • Are you open-minded, compassionate and understanding of patient's personal experiences

  • Are you goal-oriented and passionate about building relationships?

  • Do you inspire others to make positive changes and recognize progress towards goals?

  • Are you an exceptional communicator with good listening and demonstrated writing skills?

  • Are you self-motivated willing to work both individually and as part of a team?

  • Are you willing to learn new skills, be flexible and comfortable with ambiguity?

jobs.title: Sr Salesforce Developer
jobs.content:
As a Senior Salesforce.com Developer with Concur, you will contribute to the design and implementation of new features for Concurs’ growing business. You will be both a professional liaison to both IT and Concur cross-functional business groups, helping design and deliver solutions that within the Salesforce.com platform at Concur. This is a senior role, reporting to the CRM Development Manager, who will help design, partner with architecture teams, and coordinate complex work assignments. Additionally, you will participate in the hands-on implementation of many of these solutions.
This position requires hands on project management skills and work coordination skills, as well as the ability to execute, including a deep programmatic knowledge of Salesforce.com, APEX, Javascript, AJAX, HTML, XML, Java, and SQL, among others

jobs.title: Senior Full Stack Software Developer
jobs.content:
Do you love sharing web development skills with others? Are you eager to tackle the challenge of leading a team of ambitious software engineers? Are you a lifelong learner and experimenter of new things? Take on an exciting role in a fast moving technology education startup!

Overview

  • Launch Academy is seeking a Sr. experienced software developer to lead a small team of like minded engineers to guide our immersive web development program in Philadelphia.
  • We strive to provide a best-in-class educational experience. As such we are always tinkering and finding new ways to improve. Our agile educational approach and the ever-evolving technical needs of our hiring partners ensure our curriculum and the technologies we teach will remain interesting and exciting.
  • Minimum Experience 3 years

The Challenge

  • Traditional education is broken and we are seeking to offer an alternative to people who want to learn the craft of web development.
  • We've graduated and placed over 400 people to date but we have a long way to go to make a substantial impact.

The Role

  • Mentoring students in small groups and one-on-one settings
  • Writing new exercises and learning challenges to reinforce concepts
  • Developing internal education software
  • Introducing new material to the class via facilitations and small clinics

What We're Looking For

  • We're interested in candidates with more than 3 years of engineering experience and ideally team leadership experience in some capacity. Our Curriculum runs the full spectrum of modern web technologies. We teach Javascript, Ruby, SQL, HTML, CSS, React, Rails, Sinatra, and Foundation to name a few languages and frameworks.
  • Teaching experience is a definite plus but a willingness to learn how to become a better educator is a requirement.
  • Patience and empathy are qualities equally as important as technical prowess.
  • Someone who likes to help others
  • We want an engineer who has enough industry experience to know that they are excited to tackle the challenge of leading a team and the soft skills involved in that work.

Why Launch Academy?

  • Launch Academy aims to engineer the optimal path to learning web development and software engineering. Being an Experience Engineer at Launch Academy allows you to share your craft with aspiring developers alongside a team of capable and ambitious peers.
  • We're applying Agile methodologies to iteratively design a premium learning experience. Following each cohort, we take 3 weeks for some rest and reflection in order to vastly improve the next session.
  • In addition to a great team and environment for personal growth, Launch Academy offers competitive compensation, 80% coverage of health care cost, and a use it as you need it vacation policy.

Interested? Apply Here

jobs.title: Director of Software Engineering, Simulator
jobs.content:
The Director of Software Engineering at PhishMe is a motivated professional member and leader in our Software Development organization. The Director is primarily responsible for managing multiple Agile development teams for a single product line.

The successful candidate will possess a background in software development (and related technologies), have strong management skills, be able to interact with product, sales, marketing and the engineering teams, work under tight deadlines, and have experience managing complex software development projects within an Agile framework (Scrum/Kanban).

Primary Responsibilities:

  • Coordinate with Product Management, Sales, Marketing, Operations, Engineering, and internal customers to deliver functioning features, enhancements, and remediations.
  • Team capacity planning to assure that team sizes and make-up are aligned with development needs and company goals.
  • Create, maintain, and track job postings for new hires.
  • Team member onboarding/offboarding activities.
  • 1-on-1 meetings with team members.
  • Approve and track PTO and expense reports.
  • Resource/skill needs planning and balancing.
  • Create, maintain, and report on tactical and strategic schedules.
  • Establish and maintain communications with all project stake holders, participants, and business units using PhishMe standardized tools and channels.
  • Assure/coordinate communication on strategic product direction in partnership with Product Management, other impacted business units, and the software development organization.
  • Proactively ensure communication and coordination with other teams and business groups.
Ensure defined quality standards are met independently and through coordination with Quality Management.Ensure that all relevant documentation is complete and available to all project stake holders and participants in authoritative collaboration tools (currently Jira and Confluence).Spearhead training and off-site activities for the team in coordination with other engineering and business groups.Identify and provide/arrange individual training as needed.Status reporting as required but no less than on a weekly basis.
  • Prepare and deliver regular and incidental project status updates.
Perform process reviews and recommend/enact improvements in alignment with Engineering and Quality standards.
Required Skills

  • Excellent verbal and written communications skills.
  • Possess a background in Ruby development and related technologies is a plus.
  • Demonstrated experience delivering projects on-time in an Agile framework.
  • Deep understanding of SDLCs, with specific and extensive experience with Agile frameworks (Scrum/Kanban).
  • Experience as a ScrumMaster or Product Owner is a plus.
  • Approximately 10% travel.  Some occasional international travel may be required.
Experience & Education:

  • Minimum of a bachelor√¢¬Ä¬ôs degree.  Strong preference given for bachelor and advanced degrees in software technology related fields.
  • 5+ years√¢¬Ä¬ô experience in technical leadership.
  • 5+ years personnel management, including second level management of multiple teams.
Compensation

  • Competitive salary and stock options
  • 401k with company match
  • Health, vision, dental, disability, life insurance
  • Telecommuting expense reimbursement
Location

  • Leesburg, VA or US Telecommute

jobs.title: Senior Front End Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Click here to apply: https://app.jobvite.com/j?aj=oxVH3fwW&s=github

About us:

At eHarmony, we're in love with JavaScript. We use Node.js on the server-side, manage dependencies with NPM, build with Gulp, bundle client modules with webpack, and leverage Backbone, Underscore and Handlebars on both the server-side and client-side. You don't need to know all of these frameworks to work with us, but you should be craving to learn them. International expansion and rapid innovation has brought in very interesting challenges to our front end stack that we are looking to take to the next level.

About you:

  • You love writing JavaScript code and keeping up with best practices
  • You have experience starting projects from scratch as well as jumping into an existing architecture
  • You know the difference and similarities between desktop and mobile development
  • You're self-motivated, and can excel in a team-based environment
  • You understand DOM and Event Model very well
  • You're diligent about using efficient testing practices to crush bugs before they get to the users
  • You're excited about the rapid development/release cycle afforded by Node.js

Ideal You:

  • 5-7 years of experience building high-traffic web applications using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript
  • Self-starter who can drive a project from initial concept to final deliverable
  • Expert understanding of AJAX frameworks, RESTful Web Services, and JSON
  • Expert understanding of front end optimization techniques
  • BS/MS in Computer Science (or equivalent professional experience)

Your responsibilities:

  • Write efficient and reusable front end code for our mobile and desktop web applications
  • Collaborate with Product Managers, UX Designers, and Backend Engineers to deliver product features and tech initiatives
  • Identify and resolve performance and scalability issues
  • Participate in code reviews and design reviews
  • Keep up-to-date on the latest front end techniques and trends
  • Respond to customer feedback & testing

jobs.title: Android Developer
jobs.content:
Headquarters: Nashville, TN
URL: https://www.everydollar.com/

Would you enjoy building a native Android app that reach hundreds of thousands of people to help them get traction with their hard-earned money? Do you get excited about solving problems and winning in the market alongside talented product designers, product managers, and digital marketers?

The EveryDollar team launched our Android app this summer with resounding applause. The app has a 4.44 star review with 789 reviews submitted and a current install base of 150k. Our next iterations involve enhancing the app to deliver our most premium features. We are looking for just the right developers that are smart, get things done, and are in the game for fulfilling work.

Responsibilities
  • Technical design and delivery of our Android app features
  • Maintain Android environment configuration and deploy processes for rapid delivery
  • Participate fully in our agile planning and process
  • Bring ideas that enhance the customer experience and business to the product team
  • Partner with Product Managers, Interaction Designers, Testers, and Service Developers to promote best practices and deliver a world-class native experience
  • Partner with other mobile teams to set standards and best practices, and work to ensure those standards are met and improved upon

Qualifications
  • 3+ years of Android development experience
  • Experience developing highly interactive applications integrating with APIs
  • Experience working with native push message systems
  • A sense for the aesthetic and textured elements that make an app delightful to use
  • Experience working with profiling and automated/integration testing tools
  • A healthy curiosity for how to improve user experiences
  • A portfolio of shipped applications

Bonus Points
  • Passionate about the intersection of human behavior and multi-device experience
  • Deep Android community involvement
  • Experience developing applications integrating with hypermedia APIs
  • Contributes to an open source project or has presented on a development related topic at a conference or user group

*NOTE: This is a remote contract position, please follow the application instructions below. Please do not confuse this posting with other company openings that are on-site only. Thanks!

To apply: Send a resume, github username, or portfolio to matthew.ensor@daveramsey.com

jobs.title: Patient Safety Assistant
jobs.content:
The Patient Safety Assistant is an individual who possess the skills and knowledge necessary to provide one-on-one safety assistance for patients whom alternatives or restraints may not be adequate or appropriate. Under the direct supervision of a Registered Nurse the Patient Safety Assistant will: observe the patient continuously with the patient in full view, never leave the patient and utilize the call light in the patient room for all relief or assistance as needed and provide diversional activity for the patient as appropriate.

Minimum Education and Skills Required for Consideration:

  • Minimum Education: High School Graduate or equivalent.
  • Minimum Experience: 6 months of direct patient care experience in and acute or sub- acute facility or experience working in an inpatient hospital environment.
  • Required Certification/Licensure: American Heart Association BLS (Basic Life Support for Healthcare Providers) Certification

Salary range: $13.12 to $19.64

About City of Hope

City of Hope, an innovative biomedical research, treatment and educational institution with over 4000 employees, is dedicated to the prevention and cure of cancer and other life-threatening diseases and guided by a compassionate, patient-centered philosophy. Founded in 1913 and headquartered in Duarte, California, City of Hope is a remarkable non-profit institution, where compassion and advanced care go hand-in-hand with excellence in clinical and scientific research. City of Hope is a National Cancer Institute designated Comprehensive Cancer Center and a founding member of the National Comprehensive Cancer Network, an alliance of the nation‚Äôs 20 leading cancer centers that develops and institutes standards of care for cancer treatment.

jobs.title: Research Associate II - Immuno-Oncology
jobs.content:
A Research Associate II position is available in the laboratory of Leo Wang, MD, PhD, at City of Hope, Duarte, CA.

The lab‚Äôs research in the Department of Immuno-Oncology focuses on how blood cells develop, function, and interact with other cells, with a second focus on how blood stem cells become malignant. We use mass spectrometry to identify activated protein circuits in rare stem and progenitor cell populations isolated from patients and animals, using that knowledge to devise new therapies for blood disorders.

We are looking for enthusiastic, self-motivated individuals who thrive in a fast-paced challenging start-up research environment, and can interact well with others as part of a cohesive team. If you have the desire to make a significant impact in patients‚Äô lives, the drive to work hard, and the ingenuity to work smart, you will succeed within this team.

PRINCIPAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Oversee establishment of a startup laboratory and ensure a friendly, supportive, and fun environment for the lab as it grows.
  • Perform potentially intricate experiments with increasing independence over time.
  • Record data and analyze results using industry standard application suites.
  • Maintain and perform experiments with cells in tissue culture.
  • Perform preclinical rodent work (mouse handling, screening, injections, and analysis).
  • Help to prepare presentations and written articles for publication.
  • Prepare laboratory reagents, chemicals, instruments, and maintain equipment.
  • Keep detailed and accurate logs of experiments from conception to analysis, as well as of lab inventory and animal colonies.
  • Maintain operations and supplies inventory in accordance with departmental procedures.
  • There may be some travel to local area research labs for collaborations, trainings, & operational expansion.

Ensures that all laboratory activities are carried out in compliance with safety procedures and guidelines in handling, storage and disposal of materials.

WORKING CONDITIONS:

Laboratory environment: Candidates will receive training in the safe handling of toxic chemicals, biohazards, animals, and substances emitting unpleasant odors. Candidates will also occasionally works with emitters of radiation.

Follows established City of Hope and department policies, procedures, objectives, performance improvement, attendance, safety, environmental, and infection control guidelines, including adherence to the workplace Code of Conduct and Compliance Plan. Practices a high level of integrity and honesty in maintaining confidentiality.

Performs other related duties as assigned or requested.

In addition to competitive compensation and benefits, candidates will have the opportunity to learn and develop research publications and presentations. Particularly effective candidates may be given the opportunity to develop an independent project.

Minimum Education and Skills Required for Consideration:

  • B.A/B.S with significant biological science coursework required, plus two years of related experience ‚Äì one year of experience with a Masters.
  • Experience with animal husbandry techniques is highly desired. Hands-on experience with flow cytometry, molecular biology, and cell culture is also requested.
  • Ideal candidates will be self-motivated and have ambitions to further develop their scientific and career skills. They will have a desire to be challenged and to learn new scientific strategies.

SKILLS / ABILITIES / COMPETENCIES REQUIRED:

  • Ability to work productively and develop cohesive team relationships.
  • Prior animal handling experience.
  • Prior flow cytometry experience.
  • Basic molecular biology and cell culture experience.
  • High degree of computer literacy in Mac/PC based OS environments.
  • Good oral and written communication skills.
  • Must be able to logically and effectively structure tasks and set priorities.
  • Must be able to respond effectively to constructive feedback.
  • Demonstrated ability to analyze data statistically and to present it logically.
  • Energy, enthusiasm, and a positive outlook.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Excellent interpersonal skills.

About City of Hope

City of Hope, an innovative biomedical research, treatment and educational institution with over 4000 employees, is dedicated to the prevention and cure of cancer and other life-threatening diseases and guided by a compassionate, patient-centered philosophy. Founded in 1913 and headquartered in Duarte, California, City of Hope is a remarkable non-profit institution, where compassion and advanced care go hand-in-hand with excellence in clinical and scientific research. City of Hope is a National Cancer Institute designated Comprehensive Cancer Center and a founding member of the National Comprehensive Cancer Network, an alliance of the nation‚Äôs 20 leading cancer centers that develops and institutes standards of care for cancer treatment.
