jobs.title: Automotive Technician - $1,000 Sign-On Bonus - Hourly + PTO
jobs.content:
Overview

What Drives You?

  • Making your mark with a company known for excellence?
  • A chance for real work/life balance?
  • Collaborating and thriving as part of a team?
  • Exceptional rewards for excellent results?

¬†

We Share Your Drive.

¬†

Recondition and repair incoming inventory in preparation for delivery to dealerships. Reconditioning process includes identification of mechanical and physical problems, and completion of repairs to correct identified problems.¬†

Responsibilities

Exciting Responsibilities

The duties and responsibilities listed below are intended to provide general guidelines and parameters for the job and are not intended to be a comprehensive, detailed description of the job.

  • Move cars from the Inspection Center lot into and out of the shop safely for repair
  • Identify mechanical and physical defects in incoming inventory
  • Work with Inspection Center Management to repair or reject inventory based on estimated cost of repairs and/or the overall quality of the vehicle
  • Identify and complete repairs effectively and efficiently the first time, to minimize re-work and delays in production
  • May be required to test drive repaired vehicle to ensure that the problem has been completely fixed
  • Work as a contributing member of the Inspection Center team
  • Maintain positive working relationships with the Technician team and other Inspection Center employees
  • Conscientiously work in ways that decrease possibility of injury to yourself or other team members in the shop due to spills or other preventable hazardous conditions
  • Meet or exceed inventory production goals on a daily, weekly and monthly basis
  • Complete additional technical training as available and/or required
  • Conduct business within DriveTime policies and procedures
  • Act ethically, with integrity and in the best interest of the customer and the business at all times
  • Portray a positive image of DriveTime and actively participate in the creation of a positive, professional work environment

Enjoy the Rewards and Benefits

Money:¬†Competitive pay on an hourly basis. No flat-rate here!

Benefits:¬†Outstanding medical, dental and vision plans (After just 30 days)! 401K match too!
Schedule:¬†Enjoy a Monday through Friday schedule with a full 40 hour week!
Future:¬†We‚Äôre a unique, highly respected, nationwide company with a strong culture of promoting from within. This isn‚Äôt a job. It‚Äôs a career

Qualifications

Keys to success.

  • High School Diploma¬†or GED required.
  • Vocational/Technical degree or professional experience equivalent.
  • Automotive repair experience required.
  • ASE certifications strongly preferred.
  • Excellent communication and listening skills.
  • Attention to detail is required as well as the ability to interact with customers, managers and coworkers in a professional, courteous manner.
  • Valid driver's license, and insurable DMV required.
  • Must be at least 18 years of age

OR

  • Any equivalent combination of education, training and/or experience that fulfills the requirements of the position will be considered.

Hiring is contingent upon successful completion of our background and drug screening process. DriveTime is a tobacco-free workplace.¬†

PHYSICAL DEMANDS

The Physical demands described within are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

This job position is designated as a safety sensitive position

  • Must be able to lift up to 60 pounds independently; majority of lifting from knee to shoulder heights; other lifting required from various levels.
  • Must be able to carry and transport up to 60 pounds up to 20 feet.
  • Requires standing for extended period of time with frequent stretching, reaching, walking and stooping, pushing and/or pulling in an environment that may be cold, hot, noisy, and wet and may have fumes or odors due to vehicle maintenance.
  • Requires excellent visual acuity and manual dexterity.
  • Requires use of safety equipment that may include but not limited to face shield or goggles, non-slip shoes, gloves, mask, and other protective garments and equipment.
  • Requires some driving and frequent typing.
  • Must adhere to regular and predictable attendance.

¬†

jobs.title: Automotive General Manager in Training
jobs.content:
Overview

¬†

¬†

¬†

DriveTime is a billion dollar company and the Nation's largest chain of financing dealerships. We are opening 15¬†new dealerships nationwide in the next 18 months. We are¬†looking for current leaders to train and¬†become¬†General Managers of¬†our Inspection Centers, which provide support to the dealerships.

¬†

What is the Accelerated Management Program?

Our industry-defining Inspection Center Accelerated Management Program (AMP) is the ideal platform for anyone who feels they're stuck at a dead-end in their current management career. This is a unique opportunity to leverage your existing leadership skills, tune them to our business philosophy, and move forward on an advanced level of management. Through this well-defined career-path you'll enjoy accomplished colleagues with like-minded career ambition, the supportive resources of our billion dollar company, and our "small-company feel." You will have the opportunity to run an inspection center as a General Manager in 6 months or less. We'll give you the right tools and the fast track, you choose how far and how fast you accelerate your career.

¬†

¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† This position might require relocation

Responsibilities

As a General Manager, you will:

  • Ensure the dealerships are constantly supplied with a sufficient variety of high quality vehicles to meet their sales demand.
  • Achieve BLM objectives through the effective management of the Inspection Center team, operating expenses, efficiency, quality, and productivity.
  • Implement and execute all company-wide or regional level initiatives so as to maximize their impact and help meet or exceed inventory and BLM goals.
  • Complete recruiting, screening, and hiring of the Inspection Center team members using methods designed to reduce turnover and improve performance.
  • Ensure direct reports are being effectively trained and developed.

¬†

Enjoy the Rewards and Benefits

¬†

Money: Base salary and bonus potential after the 6 month training period (your near future: General Managers earn $60,000 base pay + $20,000 bonus potential.

Top Perks: Company car, industry leading management training, tuition reimbursement and a casual and fun atmosphere.

Schedule: Enjoy a 5-day work week, with weekends¬†off. Major holidays off too! We work hard and play hard, so you can expect to have work life balance with DriveTime.

Qualifications

  • A Bachelor‚Äôs degree
  • 5-7 years managing a minimum of 15 employees, preferred.
  • Supply chain management preferred.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication and listening skills.
  • Must demonstrate the ability to effectively manage and work with all levels of employees and customers, and work in conjunction with various corporate groups to achieve corporate and ground goals.
  • Willingness to relocate: opportunities for relocation are nationwide.¬† Corporate housing and relocation assistance will be provided.
  • Valid driver's license, good driving record.

¬†

Physical Demands

¬†

The Physical demands described within are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

  1. This job position is designated as a safety sensitive position.

  2. Must be able to lift up to 25 pounds independently; majority of lifting from knee to shoulder heights; other lifting required from various levels.

  3. Must be able to carry and transport up to 25 pounds up to 60 feet.

  4. Requires standing for extended period of time with frequent stretching, reaching, walking and stooping, pushing and/or pulling.

  5. Requires excellent visual acuity and manual dexterity.

  6. Requires sitting for extended periods of time. Must be able to type for extended periods of time.

  7. Requires being able to hear and speak with others in-person or on the phone.

  8. Must adhere to regular and predictable attendance.

    ¬†

And when it comes to hiring, we don't just look for the right person for the job, we seek out the right person for DriveTime. Along the way, we provide plenty of opportunity to be creative and grow professionally in a fun, high-energy environment.

¬†

Hiring is contingent upon successful completion of our background and drug screening process. DriveTime is a drug-free, tobacco-free workplace.

EOE

jobs.title: Buyer/Planner
jobs.content:
Job Description

Buyer/Planner

Cree is seeking a Buyer to join Cree‚Äôs Supply Chain team. The Buyer will be responsible for the management of Cree‚Äôs production raw materials for the LED Products Business unit. This person will be responsible for establishing master item records, driving MRP implementation, and execution of daily MRP tasks. This person will also be the primary liaison to the business unit supported to ensure proper inventory levels are maintained to meet the production demand schedule.

What can Cree do for you?

  • Potential for upward mobility in a thriving organization
  • Opportunity to be a key strategic contributor from the ground up
  • High visibility in a $1+ billion company

What can you do for Cree?

  • Establish and maintain Oracle master item records for production raw material inventories
  • Establish and maintain Oracle MRP attributes and reorder point variables that support production demand schedule
  • Execute the system MRP ‚Äì analyze order recommendations and order placement
  • Work closely to adjust¬†inventories with the business units to improve service level while controlling inventories to budget

What you need for success:

  • BS in Engineering, Business or Supply Chain related field
  • 3 years of experience with Materials Requirements Planning (MRP)
  • Demonstrated¬† experience working in a self-directed environment
  • Energetic individual who can service a dynamic and exciting manufacturing and product line
  • Excellent analytical skills
  • Responsive and good written and verbal communication skills

Highly preferred skills and certifications:

  • 5 years of experience in Material Requirements Planning (MRP) in a high volume and high technology industry
  • Capable of working cross functionally in a dynamic setting
  • Certification as a supply chain professional
  • Working knowledge of Oracle
  • Experience working with international suppliers

¬†

Company Overview

At Cree, we‚Äôre always on. We believe that meaningful change happens through sheer force of will and the determination of a team solving a problem, and we‚Äôre unafraid to kick down the door to make it happen. That‚Äôs how we inspired the LED revolution and continue to create brilliantly affordable, radically simple, uncompromisingly efficient solutions that transform the way we experience light. From inventing America‚Äôs best-selling light bulb to commercializing the brightest lighting-class LEDs, our vision isn‚Äôt just to cultivate a thriving business ‚Äì it‚Äôs to better the world. And we don‚Äôt take no for an answer. Be part of what‚Äôs next. Join our growing multi-billion dollar start-up, named a 2014 MIT Technology Review ‚Äú50 Smartest Company,‚Äù to revolutionize energy efficiency and transform the way we experience light. We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

¬†

¬†

¬†

jobs.title: Data Quality Analyst
jobs.content:
HotelTonight makes it remarkably easy to book great hotels at amazing last-minute rates on your mobile device, for tonight, tomorrow and next week. If hotel rooms are the fuel that powers HotelTonight, data is the oil that makes it fire on all cylinders. Data enables the teams to make better, timelier decisions, and enables the app to provide better hotels in the right places for users. ¬†Leveraging this data in the right way is what differentiates HotelTonight.

In this role, you will be a part of our rock-solid QA team and work in lockstep with Data Engineering to deliver business critical information that enable internal teams to make reliable, data-driven decisions for our hotel partners. You‚Äôll have the leeway to build and automate processes that improve the quality of our data integrity and what is implemented in production. Quality assurance directly impacts our bottom line, and you can help ensure reliability of tables, tools and dashboards for a great user experience!

WHAT YOU'LL DO

  • Investigate invalid/erroneous data sources by identifying the root causes of data integrity issues, and develop QA testing processes to prevent reoccurrence
  • Identify gaps in process, code, testing, and environments; and work closely with the Data Engineering team to ensure consistency of data in our reports
  • Design and create SQL test scripts (as part of unit testing) to ensure data quality
  • Perform regression testing to find unexpected issues before weekly releases
  • Document test results and clearly articulate test findings to teams at various levels, cross functionally

WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR IN YOU

  • 3+ years experience writing moderately complex SQL queries
  • 2 years of QA experience, having some experience with test automation technologies like Selenium, Cucumber, etc.
  • Strong experience with data validation using SQL across MySQL or Postgres databases
  • Experience with a database testing framework, such as DbFit, to support test-driven development of database code
  • Knowledge of a programming language like Python or Ruby is helpful
  • A self-starter who knows how to setup QA processes in an engineering org
  • Drive, dedication, enthusiasm and a desire to make a big impact on our team, product, and customers

WHAT YOU'LL GET FROM US

  • The opportunity to define mobile commerce and change the way people book travel
  • The camaraderie of a driven, agile team that is building something disruptive
  • Great SF office location at Market & 5th St. (If you live out of the area, move here!)
  • Unlimited vacation, quarterly travel credits to stay with our amazing hotels, and spontaneous trips ¬†
  • Competitive compensation and pre-IPO options at a thriving company funded by top investors
  • Healthcare premiums covered for employees, FSA/HSA, 401(k), Commuter benefits
  • Sweet perks - catered meals daily, all-you-can-consume coffee & snacks, access to our hotel-inspired full bar, kegerators with cold brews on tap, subsidized fitness membership, shiny MacBook & Thunderbolt display, our annual ping-pong tournament, and a gong that you‚Äôll get to bang when you ship something amazing!

jobs.title: Visual Web Designer
jobs.content:
Yext is looking for a passionate, relentless Web Designer to add to the team.

We are building a team that will revolutionize and disrupt a market while delivering amazing products and solutions to our clients.


Please note that all applicants should submit a link to their online website/portfolio


Overview


Yext is the global location data management leader, and our mission is to help people Go Places‚Ñ¢. The award-winning Yext Location Cloud enables companies of all sizes to manage location data across their websites, mobile apps, internal systems, and the industry‚Äôs largest ecosystem of maps, apps, social networks, directories, and search engines including Google, Apple, Facebook, Bing, and Yahoo. Learn more about how we help people go places at yext.com.


The Yext Tysons Corner, VA office is located at 7900 Westpark Drive McLean, VA in the Silverline Center. http://www.silverlinecenter.com/ Perks include free catered lunch daily and free on-site gym!


Our Consulting Group works with Yext‚Äôs largest clients to deliver highly-customized and integrated products. ¬†Our work is leaps and bounds beyond our competitors and is seen by millions of people across the globe. The team includes Project Management, Creative, and Software Engineering experts that work together to deliver end-to-end solutions. We value things like: curiosity, failing forward, productivity hacks, excellent communication, a sense of humor, and confidence without ego.

We're Growing! Yext needs a ridiculously talented entry-level Visual Web Designer to augment our creative team. You'll be designing elegant solutions to complex problems along with our Creative Lead, fellow Visual Designers, our UX Designer, and the Development Team. You‚Äôll be a key player in maintaining the visual design bar, evolving our prototyping process, and improving our team‚Äôs craft. Our SaaS software is extremely powerful, but the aesthetic experience should always be effortless and intentional.

Our ideal candidate



  • You live and breathe design. You have an eye for balance, proportion and rhythm. Your love for typography, layout, grid design, and beautiful interfaces runs deep.

  • You‚Äôre enthusiastic about an iterative design process. You aren‚Äôt afraid to throw away beautiful design work if it‚Äôs not the right solution for the problem at hand.

  • Your skills get measurably better over time and you never stop working on your craft. When looking at your portfolio, it's clear you've never stopped improving.

  • You have no problem giving and receiving constructive critique and design direction.

  • You are compulsively trying out new Websites and apps in order to help build a solid and up-to-date understanding of best practices/trends in Web and mobile design patterns.

  • You have a higher bar for your work than anyone else. When others feel a design is good enough, you keep polishing, keep simplifying, and keep pushing for more clarity.

  • You are eager to discuss, defend, and implement your design ideas.



What you‚Äôd be doing



  • Producing high-quality visual Web designs‚Äîfrom concept to execution, including those for desktop, tablet, and mobile devices at a variety of resolutions (icons, graphics, and marketing materials)

  • Creating and iterate on assets that reflect a client‚Äôs brand, enforce a language, and inject beauty and life into a product

  • Pushing creativity, challenge established thinking, and discover new ways of approaching (and solving) a problem

  • Partnering with Software Engineers to implement your designs just as you had envisioned



Minimum requirements



  • BA/BS degree in Design (e.g., interaction, graphic, visual communications, product, industrial), HCI, or a related field or equivalent practical experience. Summer 2017 graduates are encouraged¬†to apply!

  • 0-2 years of professional experience as visual designer for web applications and services

  • Proficiency in tools like Sketch, Box, Invision App, Keynote and Adobe Creative Suite

  • A jaw-dropping online portfolio, free of type-o‚Äôs



Helpful, but not necessary



  • Familiarity with Twitter Bootstrap screen sizes and 12-column grid principle

  • Front-End Web skills (HTML, CSS, Javascript, etc.)

  • Experience designing for variable data (CMS-driven layouts)

  • Ability to create style guides to be used cross-functionally

  • Interaction design sensibility


¬†


Compensation, Benefits & Perks


Yext currently employs over 500 amazing people around the globe. Our headquarters are in the historic Flatiron District in New York City, with additional offices in Chicago, Dallas, London, and Washington DC. Yext offers the following exceptional benefits: competitive compensation, 401k, unlimited snacks, daily meal allowance, flexible hours / paid time off, and excellent health / dental / vision insurance. Our mission is to help people go places‚Äîboth consumers to our customers‚Äô doorsteps and our employees to new heights in their careers. We treat our employees well and offer tremendous growth opportunities. Challenging work pushes our people to be creative in a casual environment that is caring, fun, and collaborative. We believe that when you have smart, happy people working together you can produce something special. ¬†


About ¬†¬†¬†


Yext is based in the heart of New York City with over 500 employees worldwide operating in Chicago, Dallas, Washington D.C., Germany, and the UK. Yext has been recognized as one of America‚Äôs fastest growing companies by the Inc. 500 (#212 in 2015), one of Forbes‚Äô Most Promising Companies (2014 & 2015) and one of Fortune's Best Places to Work (2014 & 2015). Learn more about how we help people go places at yext.com.


¬†


¬†

jobs.title: Account Manager
jobs.content:

The Account Manager leads the day-to-day for the account team, collaborating with the Products & Services team to develop and execute innovative and creative solutions for our clients.

Responsibilities

  • High levels of integrity, autonomy, and self-motivation

jobs.title: Ruby on Rails Programmer, BEAR Center (0652U) 22045
jobs.content:
Ruby on Rails Programmer, BEAR Center (0652U) 22045

Off Campus-Berkeley

The University of California, Berkeley, is one of the world‚Äôs most iconic teaching and research institutions. Since 1868, Berkeley has fueled a perpetual renaissance, generating unparalleled intellectual, economic and social value in California, the United States and the world. Berkeley‚Äôs culture of openness, freedom and acceptance‚Äîacademic and artistic, political and cultural‚Äîmake it a very special place for students, faculty and staff.Berkeley is committed to hiring and developing staff who want to work in a high performing culture that supports the outstanding work of our faculty and students. In deciding whether to apply for a staff position at Berkeley, candidates are strongly encouraged to consider the alignment of the Berkeley Workplace Culture with their potential for success at http://jobs.berkeley.edu/why-berkeley.html.

The Berkeley Evaluation and Assessment Research (BEAR) Center, established in 1994, is a complex research and service unit that conducts research on the integration of assessment (the measurement of individual students, teachers, schools, and other institutions) and evaluation (the use of such assessments to study educational and social intervention). The core of this research is the development and use of appropriate assessment methods for evaluating students, schools, and educational policy. The Center collaborates with researchers in universities nationally and internationally to develop software and other resources for constructing, managing, administering, and analyzing assessment.

Responsibilities Responsibilities include:

  • Applies advanced applications programming concepts to maintain and modify existing software applications by analyzing requirements and specifications for requested features and refine them with internal clients.
  • Lead a team to design and develop new Ruby on Rails applications in a test-driven environment using rails best practices. This might involve flowcharting, coding, data analysis, testing, deploying and developing processes and researching and implementation of software tools.
  • Design complex programming and database logic.
  • Implement automated unit and integration tests as part of the development process.
  • Optimize the performance and improve the scalability of the application.
  • Prepares and participates in creating detailed technical documentation.
  • Initiates and recommends changes in development, maintenance and system standards.
  • Leads and mentors other programmers in following coding standards. Champion of best practices for agile, design patterns and test-driven development.
  • Understands industry practices and department policies and procedures relating to work assignments.
  • Interacts with peers, managers and supervisors across the organization and with partnering organizations/institutions.
  • Helps with conducting interviews for all potential candidates and recommends potential candidates for management. Helps with performance ratings, performance reviews and formulates justifications on recommendations.
  • Monitor reports and execute the product roadmap, managing programming assignments and ensuring deadlines and milestones are met.

Required Qualifications Knowledge and Skills:

  • Requires advanced knowledge of applications programming, Must have experience building complex software applications.
  • Must have development expertise in Ruby on Rails and ORM framework (ex Active Record), HTML5, Javascript, AJAX framework (ex. jQuery).
  • Requires 5 to 7 years of Programming experience and 2-5 years experience with Ruby on Rails.
  • Knowledge of department processes and procedures.
  • Requires advanced skills associated with programming design, modification and implementation. Familiar with Agile development and methodology.
  • Requires interpersonal skills in order to work with both technical and non-technical personnel at various levels within the organization.
  • Must be able to communicate technical information in a clear and concise manner.
  • Requires ability to understand business needs and how business systems can support those needs.
  • Must be self-motivated, work independently or as part of a team, able to learn quickly, meet deadlines and demonstrate problem solving skills.
  • Must have advanced skills in web applications, web programming language and object oriented programming concepts.
  • Must show demonstrated abilities to learn new technologies quickly.Education/Training:
  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field

Salary For information on the comprehensive benefits package offered by the University visit: http://ucnet.universityofcalifornia.edu/compensation-and-benefits/index.html

To Apply: Please submit your cover letter and resume as a single attachment when applying through http://apptrkr.com/873693

jobs.title: Sr. Technical Product Manager
jobs.content:
Noom is a wellness technology company with over 33M people using our products. We fight the biggest and baddest killers out of our generation like obesity, smoking and heart disease using a mixture of psychology, technology, physiology, design, and just a touch of magic. We want you to join our product organization at the highest level and help us get a billion people healthy.



We are a design and engineering focused company, with top-tier founders, team members, and investors. We're backed by RRE and other strong VCs, we’ve made the world's #1 top-grossing Android fitness app. We have a number of wellness products in our portfolio, Noom Health and Noom Coach to name a few, and will continue to drastically improve the current ones as well as launch totally new ones. Both involve totally breakthrough product innovation, so expect to be constantly challenged. Expect also to use your gut and confirm it with data, and convince passionate team members about why they should follow a certain product direction. Expect to hear from thousands of people whose lives you changed.



Expect to build a huge wellness technology company. Sounds like fun? Read on.
 


What you'll do:



  • Lead groups of incredible engineers, designers, marketers to create features or entire new product lines (We call these missions)

  • Understand user behavior both qualitatively and quantitatively (work with UX Researchers, A/B tests, analytics), and apply the learnings

  • Articulate and drive home the measurable goals for the mission based on a product vision

  • Motivate. Make sure everyone in the mission is happy, engaged, and operating with maximum leverage

  • Strategize. Shape the product vision & strategy working together with product, executive team and other groups to develop new missions

  • Hustle & ship. Design, market, write copy, learn to ride the unicycle. Do whatever a mission needs to succeed!



Who you are:



  • You've lived and breathed product at a high-tech start-up (or independent division of a larger company) at least for the past 3-5 years

  • You have past successes working in a cross-functional environment to ship high quality software products

  • You love understanding users -- using qualitative and quantitative means

  • You have a strong technical foundation, with ideally a degree in engineering or computer science

  • Super smart. And don't need to show it.



You'll work full-time at our office in Chelsea, in the heart of New York City. We will grow Noom to new heights together. Btw, check out our amazing culture.

jobs.title: Technical Product Owner
jobs.content:
Do you get excited when you read Ben Horowitzs definition of a good product owner? Do you love setting the vision of software products and bringing them to market? Do you analyze every product you interact with and internalize good and bad ideas? Do you consider yourself the CEO of your current successful software product? If so, this role is for you.

We are looking for a world-class Technical Product Owner to help us define and build the software products that underpin our continued success. You are going to be the CEO of your product and be fully hands on with everything from setting the vision to the execution to continual refinement as you receive feedback from customers. You work closely with company executives and with our customers to understand their needs, interpret them into requirements, work with the design team to build mockups then get them built by your dedicated engineering team.

You will be working directly with our engineering teams to make your roadmap reality. As a result, we are looking for a person that has a technical software background. We will be measuring your performance based on the volume of quality features being released to production - which emphasizes how tightly you will be working with the various execution teams.

This is a completely remote position. You can work from anywhere in the world but also with people from all over the world. Therefore strong communication and presentation skills will be crucial for your success.


Company Description:

Aurea enables global enterprises to create transformative experiences for their end customers across a range of industries including retail, travel & hospitality, insurance, energy, life sciences, and insurance. Aurea products enable companies to build, execute, monitor, and optimize the end-to-end customer journey across multiple channels and touch-points to maximize growth through a superior customer experience. Aurea serves over 2,000 customers worldwide.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Work with stakeholders to develop the vision and define the software product roadmap that will add significant value to Aurea

  • Create innovative user interactions and work with our visual designers to create great visual comps

  • Create detailed specifications from high level ideas

  • Work with our engineering teams daily in one scrum team to go from comps to working software

  • Create and prioritize the product backlog

  • Manage a development process with an expected weekly (or faster) production release within a fast changing and highly agile framework

  • Experience working mostly with tech-heavy projects

  • Continuously collect customer feedback and build suggested improvements into the product


Total compensation: $100,000/year

Location: Global (remote)

40 hours per week

jobs.title: Xamarin Architect - $60k
jobs.content:
Xamarin Architect - $60k


Are you one of top Software Architects in the world? Are you passionate about developing mobile apps? Do you enjoy solving the incredibly complex problems that no one else has been able to complete? Are you 2x more productive than the typical engineer? Are you interested in earning $60,000 USD while working for the best companies from the comfort of your home? Eager to join a network of the most talented remote workers in the world? If so, this role is for you.

Du Pont Telecom is a specialised telecommunication company based in Johannesburg, South Africa. They offer specialist IT and communications expertise, using premium equipment. Du Pont Telecom is uniquely positioned to assess, install, test and maintain any combination of voice and data communication services. Du Pont Telecoms expertise allows them to cater for corporate clients and owner-managed businesses. Offering PBX solutions, video conferencing, mobile business contracts, VOIP technology, Least Cost Routing (LCR) and expense management, delivering an end-to-end suite of telephony services. All their products are approved by the Information Communications Authority of South Africa (ICASA) and are aligned with international best practice.


DuPont is partnering with Crossover to fill this position. Crossover specializes in finding and managing the talent in todays global workforce and will help you through the recruiting process.

At DuPont you will play a dynamic leadership role in our fast-paced environment. You will be responsible for developing solutions to complex problems, designing and delivering real enterprise-class software products to customers and being a hands-on peer leader of top development resources.

Are you interested in earning $60,000 USD while working for the best companies from the comfort of your home? Eager to join a network of the most talented remote workers in the world? Company Description

OnTheGoSystems are the makers of WPML and Toolset. The company began in 2007, today it has 78 dedicated full time staff members from 6 continents, 35 countries, and 69 cities. OnTheGoSystems come from different cultures and operate out of different time zones. This differences inspire them to expand into new markets, and its diversity gives them the courage to take on new challenges. OnTheGoSystems WordPress plugins have been mentioned in media all around the world. Their goal is to make the lives of the WordPress community easier.


OnTheGoSystems is partnering with Crossover to fill this position. Crossover specializes in finding and managing the talent in todays global workforce and will help you through the recruiting process.

Job Description

At OnTheGoSystems you will play a dynamic leadership role in our fast-paced environment. You will be responsible for developing solutions to complex problems, designing and delivering real enterprise-class software products to customers and being a hands-on peer leader of top development resources.

Key Responsibilities

  • Design, build, and maintain efficient, reusable, and reliable Ruby code

  • Ensure the best possible performance, quality, and responsiveness of the applications

  • Identify bottlenecks and bugs, and devise solutions to these problems

  • Help maintain code quality, organization, and automatization.

jobs.title: Demandware Software Engineering Manager - $140K
jobs.content:
Demandware Software Engineering Manager - $140K

If you are an elite Software Engineering Manager eager to gain unprecedented visibility to the top technology companies throughout the globe, employ your technical and managerial skills to oversee cutting-edge software in a high-intensity environment, and earn $140,000 USD per year while working from virtually anywhere on the planet, this job is for you.


What to Expect as a Software Engineering Manager at Crossover

Crossover is looking for Software Engineering Managers who demonstrate outstanding managerial skills as well as the technical background to deeply understand the code their teams are developing. You will be expected to demonstrate both a mastery of the technical skills associated with the projects at hand, as well as the managerial ability to motivate, build, and monitor your team. Specifically, you will be responsible for overseeing from 4 to 6 teams of 3 to 4 individuals. You will own the process of breaking specifications created by the product management team into clear tasks and timelines, as well as assembling the results into high value, reusable components. Under your leadership, we expect to see consistent improvement in both static code quality metrics and weekly production.

Compensation

  • Salary: 70 USD/hr

  • Position type: 40+ hours per week

  • Location: Global

The Type of Software Engineering Managers Were Looking For

A successful Software Engineering Manager at Crossover will demonstrate the following qualities:

  • Exceptional ability to effectively motivate and manage teams of individuals

  • Excellent remote management skills (you will be using Skype, GoToMeeting, Google Docs, etc.)

  • Ruthless commitment to impeccable code quality

  • Deep understanding of a wide range of the latest technologies and architectural approaches

  • Advanced understanding of Demandware and ecommerce platforms

  • Advanced proficiency in one or more core programming languages (Java or C#), related frameworks, and best practices

  • The ability to make appropriate technical decisions, review design and code, and ensure best technical practices

  • Commitment to hands-on engagement as an individual within the team, despite managerial status

  • Willingness to embrace iterative development as the means for building seamless products

  • Perfectionism: knowing how a job should be done and not stop until its done correctly

  • Commitment to increasing efficiency in the workplace by continuously automating parts of the software engineering process

  • Must be willing to work 4-5 hours/day overlap with US EST time zone.

Next Steps

Start the process now by following our application link. If you meet the qualifications, we will proceed with a series of evaluations and interviews. Your evaluations will consist of both an in-depth, code-based assessment designed to evaluate your technical proficiency, as well as a management assessment designed to evaluate your skills as a team leader. Crossover is eager to see what you have to offer our cutting edge global workforce.

jobs.title: Speculative Applications  Software Engineer
jobs.content:
At our Cranfield based Web Development Centre of Excellence, we are responsible for the development of a number key components of the iDirect product, as well as providing professional services, training and product support to our global user-base. Satellite networks are complex systems; configuration, maintenance, monitoring and reporting is made a lot easier with our innovative web-based Network Management System tools we develop here at Cranfield.


iDirect Pulse, our primary NMS, is made up of three key components; a C++ based Back-End which collects and caches real-time information from around the network, a JavaScript based Front-End which visualises this information for the user, and a Perl/Node based Middle-End, which acts as an interface between the BE and FE. All three components seamlessly work together to allow for management of the wider iDirect satellite platform.


Our organisation as a whole is very much Scrum/Agile focussed, and as such we work in diverse teams where thoughts and ideas are shared and collaboration is actively encouraged. This gives all our staff the opportunity to work across the product, really getting to understand exactly how and why it operates, and how it fits seamlessly within the larger iDirect communication platform.



About you:


We’re looking for the very best candidates to join us in Cranfield, where you will work alongside a wider team of smart, creative and dedicated colleagues. We value a good approach to problem solving, logical thinking and the enthusiasm, passion and ability to learn new skills quickly


Those who are successful within iDirect:



  • Are excited by and demonstrate a passion for the latest developments in web technology

  • Enjoy regularly coming up with clever, creative solutions to difficult problems

  • Have strong communication skills, and enjoy sharing ideas and knowledge with technical and non-technical colleagues across the globe

  • Show a strong ownership ethic

  • Display both flexibility and dedication to their work, colleagues and product

  • Show a genuine interest in learning about satellite communication

jobs.title: DevOps Architect
jobs.content:
The Development Operations Architect will work collaboratively with the Continuous Integration and development engineering teams to boost the overall organizational performance of iDirect’s development operations. You will be looked to for setting and advancing our overall DevOps technical strategy.


You will help architect, streamline and automate our product operations and processes through build and test automation. Build and maintain tools for deployment, systems monitoring and operational support; troubleshoot / resolve issues in our automated development, test and production environments.


You will be responsible for the System Administration of Linux systems and applications used to support our development operations; integrate and manage development systems for embedded and non-embedded applications and build RPM packages for deployment and test.

jobs.title: Senior .NET Developer
jobs.content:
Your job will include:



  • Help architecting, building and extending the crossvertise online marketplace for advertising media

  • Develop and implement new, exiting features in order to simplify the planning and booking of advertising campaigns

  • Leveraging the power of Microsoft’s cloud computing platform Windows Azure for our application

  • Mentoring and providing an example for junior and intermediate developers on the team


You will work in an international, dynamic and highly motivated cross-functional team based in Munich. We have great working conditions in a nice office in Schwabing across the street from the English Garden. We offer you access to the latest and best technologies and tools in the .NET world (we are a Microsoft Silver Partner).  Our dev team members come from 8 different countries, so our day-to-day language is english but we also provide free German courses for both beginner and intermediate German speakers.


Besides an attractive remuneration you will find short decision paths, flexible working condition, and much room for creativity and clever solutions. And of course we regularly have fun together outside the office - from grilling at the Isar, to skiing, to enjoying festivals like Tollwood and Oktoberfest.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content:
At comparethemarket.com, we ctm'ers look to push the edge with new technologies so that we can deliver the very best for the business. Our team spirit means everyone's opinion is important in building top class software.



We are advocates and evangelists of Agile methodologies, so that we are able to adapt and change course, depending on business needs. Our focus is our customer, building software that we believe will make a difference.


It would be great to hear from you if you’re a passionate developer, who is able to coach and mentor other people. Whether you're a front-end enthusiast who loves building slick responsive webpages in HTML5 and CSS3, a server side developer who relishes the challenge of asynchronous enterprise systems, or a system admin looking to get into development team to help them deliver working software fast, if you fit, we'll find a place for you. You enjoy working in teams, being heard and sharing the passion you have for creating software. Wherever you are in your development journey, if you have a passion for building great software in the coolest new tech, we want to hear from you.

jobs.title: Senior JavaScript Developer - Front End
jobs.content:
Front End JavaScript ..ers, Infomedia Ltd are hunting for you. Who are we and why would you want to join our team? Infomedia are an ASX listed who are a global leader in SaaS information solutions to the parts and service sector of the global automotive industry. Infomedia's business solutions are currently used each business day by over 150,000 dealership personnel. They are produced in more than 30 languages and at work in 186 countries. 
  
At Infomedia we do things differently. We develop niche, one-of-a-kind software solutions for the automotive industry but we also know that to stay unique and to continue to be the leader in our industry we need unique and one-of-a-kind thought leaders and intelligent problem solvers who are always striving to take our products to the next level. We pride ourselves on our values of Integrity, Innovation, Togetherness, Care and on having a Global mindset in everything we do to ensure we are always thinking BIG!

This is where you come in.....

What are we looking for?

Looking at our project pipeline, between new product development, enhancements to the current product suite, migrations between platforms etc. the type of people who will be successful in these roles are real JavaScript aficionados and Front End perfectionists. Problem solvers by nature and those who want to be developing on a truly global scale. Far more than your usual role in a dev shop.

We're thinking that these people look something like this:
  • 5+ years of Front End Development experience with strong focus on JavaScript (ideally multiple libraries)
  • Solid experience in AngularJS, ideally with some knowledge of Angular2
  • Product development expertise highly regarded
  • Creative clean code aficionado
  • Background in SaaS product environment
  • Strong communication skills both written and verbal and awesome attention to detail
To us the passion is a no brainer. Our team is made up of intelligent analytical problem solvers and both current and future thought leaders who are not shy of throwing out solutions to problems and jumping in at the deep end. These people will be the master of their own destiny - Infomedia will nurture, support and guide any of our team into whatever technology or business skill that the want to grow into, but you will be accountable for being the driving force behind that progression. You will be joining a company who doesn't just throw out an awesome marketing spiel to lure you in just for you to realize you have joined another humdrum dev shop. Our team works with some of the coolest technologies around, building some seriously innovative and interesting products and we have a culture of openness, honesty and creativity.
  
Some other key benefits:
  • Onsite gym facilities for staff
  • Food provided daily
  • Games area
  • Onsite parking
  • Fun, relaxed but very high performing environment!
Sound like you? Then hit the apply button and drop us over your profile - we want to chat with you..

jobs.title: DevOps Manager
jobs.content:
The DevOps manager will be in charge of managing the DevOps team at Spokeo. This role requires a strong people manager who will have oversight of the entire infrastructure for running the Spokeo website, as well as providing support for any projects being worked on. 

DevOps is responsible for all the production environments as well as test and internal environments, as well as facilities and office operations. The DevOps manager is responsible for hiring sysadmins and effectively coordinating and managing work schedules for all of his/her staff members.



Desired Skills and Experience:



  • 5+ years of DevOps system administration experience. 

  • Significant experience with AWS and other cloud services. 

  • Strong people management experience: having managed at least 5-10 individuals. 

  • Articulate: eloquent in working with many personalities and in cross functional teams. 

  • Strong verbal and written communication skills.

  • Experience with *NIX system administration, Java, Ruby, Perl, Python.

  • Strong technical and business vision.

  • Experience in an internet customer-facing environment.

  • Ability to work cross organizational boundaries with people of different perspectives and experiences.

  • Ability to recognize technical needs and recommend suitable technologies.

  • Willingness to tackle any challenge, even if not directly relevant to core competencies. 


We Provide:



  • Top Salary

  • Flexible Hours

  • Casual Dress Code

  • Stock Options

  • Free Lunch Catering Every Day

  • Nerf Gun Armory

  • Medical, Dental, and Vision Benefits

jobs.title: Principal Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Amperity, a stealth-mode enterprise software company, is looking for a Principal full-stack software engineer to join our initial team as we build the next great billion-dollar Seattle company! Using the cloud, scale-out automation, data science, and a pinch of machine learning, we're taking siloed enterprise data and turning it into integrated, actionable datasets!


Amperity is backed by some of the most notable names in tech -- including Madrona Venture Group, Liquid 2 Ventures, Hyde Park Ventures, and top executives and founders from multi-billion dollar companies like Amazon, Microsoft, Concur, and Isilon Systems. Amperity is well capitalized, having raised $9M in its seed round in February. Full press release


If you thrive on solving hard problems, have a desire to push yourself to the limits, and want to have fun in the process, then we would love to talk with you about joining our team.


Interesting problems:



  • Our system involves ingestion of terabytes of data per day, blending batch processing with real-time events

  • We automatically combine data together across disparate systems, and improve this process in generalized ways

  • We allow users to perform complex, real-time queries across aggregated datasets


Technologies we use:



  • Open Source tools, such as Accumulo, Spark, and Kafka

  • Cloud-first automation, including Apache Aurora and SaltStack

  • Neural nets, random forests, logistic regression, and probabilistic databases

  • Emacs AND vi!


About you:



  • You have at least 10 years of software development experience

  • You have experience leading complex distributed systems

  • You think about scalable architectures and great customer end to end experience

  • You improve things by 10x, not just 10%

  • You have worked in a DevOps environment, and drive sustainability such that DevOps is more Dev than Ops

  • You have built JVM oriented production systems

  • Your ears perk up when somebody says “graph traversal”

  • You are open-minded, inclusive, and motivated to make good decisions

  • You bring something new and rare to the party!

jobs.title: Senior Front End Developer
jobs.content:
Creatubbles™ is the safe global community for creators of all ages. It is the perfect space for children, families and teachers to save, share, discover and interact with multimedia creativity portfolios. It lets anyone share their experiences and creations safely in more than 50 countries, whether they are at home, school, an event or activity.


We recognize creativity is a critical life skill to be developed and nurtured like any other form of expression. We believe in the importance of finding and developing your individual voice by being able to express thoughts and ideas freely.



Creatubbles™ is an integrated creativity ecosystem with a growing list of partners that believe in nurturing creativity through a safe and supportive environment.


With 'Share with Creatubbles', any company, organization or individual can very easily connect to and use Creatubbles™ to engage in meaningful (and creative!) ways.




  •        Main site: www.creatubbles.com

  •        Blog: https://stateoftheart.creatubbles.com

  •        Partners: https://partners.creatubbles.com




About our company


We are an ambitious team of around 18 people, covering 11 nationalities and operating as a network of virtual teams around the world. After closing a strategic partnership in Japan we are quickly building out our team in Tokyo.


Having recently raised a total of $16MM from private and strategic corporate investors, we have plenty of fuel in the tank to build out our product, our team and to fund our global expansion.


To fulfill our mission to nurture the original creativity of children around the world, we are constantly exploring new ways to incorporate the latest ideas, approaches, and technologies into our products and services.



About our development Team and Technologies



  • Our development team is headed by an experienced CTO, 1 front-end developer, 4 full-stack developers and one test engineer.

  • We start the day with a Scrum call and organise our work in 2-weekly Sprints.

  • Github, Codeship, Heroku and Amazon AWS are just a couple of the many friends we rely on every single day.

  • ScreenHero allows us to enjoy pair-programming sessions, even when members are located on the other side of the world.

  • Our team is small and flexible, and everyone participates in the decision-making process.

  • We love Ruby on Rails but have switched our web app over to Ember.js in the past year, building up a lot of Ember.js experience.

  • With our apps we support desktop browsers, smartphone and tablet devices and keep pushing the boundaries of responsive web and CSS techniques.

  • Our focus is building and keep iterating on universal experiences and interfaces that work for and delight users between ages of 1 and 99.

  • The back-end is made available to our web app, our native mobile apps and our partner's applications as a simple REST API.

  • Security is extremely important to us and we regularly work with experts to review our security strategy.




About you




  • You have experience working with Rails and one of the Javascript frameworks.

  • You know your way with databases and APIs but what you are really passionate about is javascript, html and css.

  • You insist on clean code that leads to beautiful user-interfaces.

  • You have experience with data-driven product development: analytics, A/B testing, etc

  • You have experience troubleshooting cross-browser compatibility issues

  • You take quality and testing very seriously. Very very seriously. Obviously.

  • You are fluent in spoken and written English (knowledge of Japanese is a big plus).

  • You have a pro-active personality, are a real team player and feel comfortable working in a fast-paced tech startup environment.

  • You have a fundamental interest in what we are doing and show empathy for our users.

  • You have a general curiosity and an ability to embrace complexity



What we offer



  • A full time job opportunity, but part-time contractors are also welcomed.

  • We love remote work but relocation to Tokyo can also be arranged.

  • Super-flexible work schedule: we work across time zones and allow everyone to work when they are the most productive.

  • A very competitive salary and possibly stock options.

jobs.title: Full Stack Developer
jobs.content:
Full Stack Developer - Product Engineer

TransferWise is a VC-backed, international money transfer start-up co-founded by Skype’s first employee and backed by some of planet's most experienced innovators, including Sir Richard Branson and PayPal founder Peter Thiel, we're disrupting the world of currency & international money transfer. That means flipping a gazillion dollar industry on its head using only real exchange rates and tiny non-hidden-fee. Headaches averted, revolution sparked.

Are you up to building a modern international financial institution from the ground up, but better than any of the existing global banks? We are looking for a number of Product Engineers to join our Tallinn office. As a Full Stack Product Engineer you will have solid experience with the full stack of web technologies. You will be hands on within the technology and working towards making our product the best that it can be by solving the challenges that we face. However our flat organisational structure means you'll be someone who is unconcerned with titles and hierarchy. What really excites you is problem solving and delivering innovative technology and products that create happy customers.



You will collaborate with product managers, UX and design experts, data scientists and other developers to work towards one unified goal - growth. There are a number of teams that we are currently looking for awesome developers to join in Tallinn, you will be applying for all and throughout your journey with us you will get to find out about them all!



As part of the a Product-Engineering team, you'll be making sure that the user journey is as precise and delightful as it can be. You'll join a great team that is customer focussed to it’s core.



Product engineers only

Here at TransferWise we don’t hire coders, who pick up tickets from a backlog and push code to production.

We hire engineers that empathise with our customers problems, develop solutions and measure results. We’re proud of engineering team - it's built an incredible product that’s changing the world. They operate autonomously within their teams, focussing relentlessly on our customers.

jobs.title: Junior/Senior JavaScript Developer
jobs.content:
We are the leading global company in the expanding online recipe kit delivery market. This is a unique opportunity to gain valuable and challenging experience at a rapidly growing startup. Responsibility is given from day one to use your initiative and creativity to help us grow our business. We are fast-paced and love the food world.


As a member of our experienced IT team you will be exposed to a modern technology stack and a very professional and agile project management setup. We have developed a highly refined product in the last years and now massively scale up the company on a global level. Join us and help building up a fresh food global champion!



About the job




  • Developing the HelloFresh web presences in 6 countries

  • Development and implementation of new features 

  • Close cooperation with Backend Developers and Designers 

  • Creating a smooth and pleasant end user experience

  • A-B testing to optimize our website

jobs.title: Senior Android Developer
jobs.content:
• Development and implementation of new and exciting features for our award-winning idealo travel App to help our users plan their next holidays

  • In cooperation with UX and Project Management teams, your UX expertise will help us achieve great user experience

  • Involvement with technical task and contribution to the overall development process including assessment of requirements and architectural decisions

  • In cooperation with our Backend Team you will define the necessary Infrastructure needed to make our Apps to innovative Products

jobs.title: Lead UI Artist
jobs.content:
Our goals for this role



  • Your goal is to help DIGIT continue the growth of our hit title Kings of the Realm

  • You will bring our title to the next level, helping DIGIT to truly push the boundaries of UI design in the game

  • As Lead UI Artist, you will be hands on, as well as leading a small experienced team of games UI designers.


Here's what you will be doing



  • Provide art direction and own the UI for the game

  • Rapidly deliver intuitive and rewarding user interfaces to millions of players for all new game features

  • Design fully responsive user interfaces, that work seamlessly across multiple mobile devices

  • Concept, create and validate UI designs for the game (from user flows through to release)

  • Assist in rapid iterations and testing ideas (using wireframes and sketches, in-engine mockups etc.)

  • Create clean and easy to implement UI assets, which can seamlessly move straight over to the development team and into games production

  • Own the UI pipeline - create and define style guides and monitor consistency and quality across your team

  • Lead and technically manage a small skilled team of UI designers - review work daily, act as technical mentor and guide, set goals etc.

  • Guide the UI vision and art direction across the team (explorations, colour, composition, iconography etc.)

  • Innovate and try new things - always push the quality bar on every single topic.

jobs.title: Development Team Lead, 80-100%
jobs.content:
You will be the top tech person in our company, responsible for the development team and its output. As the interface between your team and the rest of the company, you’ll be translating business needs into architectural decisions and manageable features. Because our CEO was previously the CTO, you will get lots of understanding and appreciation for the work of your team. Besides your managing duties, we also expect you to get your hands dirty in code on a daily basis.


Responsibilities:



  • Manage our team of software developers, which currently consists of five people

  • Take decisions on our architecture from backend to frontend, which currently consists of a Python REST API hosted on AWS and AngularJS as well as native iOS and Android apps on the client side

  • Lead by example by writing well-tested, concise code across our stack

  • Choose the right tools and institute good development practices

  • Be the interface between the development team and the rest of the company

  • Manage the hiring process for your team


In addition to senior candidates with management experience, we are also considering ambitious juniors who want to take the next step in their career.

jobs.title: Full Stack Engineer - Thailand - Bangkok
jobs.content:
Crazy Factory Background


Crazy-Factory.com is the world’s largest online piercing store. Our company was founded 10 years ago and is continually growing. We sell 17.000+ products worldwide.


To expand and implement our current projects we are expanding our IT team at our headquarters in Thailand Bangkok. If you think you have what it takes to work with an international team on the biggest piercing online shop in the world, see specs below!


Projects


We have exciting projects lined up:



  • Shop redesign

  • Expanding our current ERP

  • More Community Options

    • User Designs (+Voting)

    • Blog

    • Achievements

    • Style coach



  • Custom Shop Designs (Metal vs Gothic vs Pop vs Unicorn…)

  • Automation of our daily factory processes

  • New mobile App

  • “Product Configurator” (customization)

  • API Design & Implementation

  • Several Apps for extended Services and broader audience


Challenges



  • Around 17.000+ products

    • + different sizes

    • + different colors

    • + different styles



  • A single product can have up to 34.463 variations

    • For example:

    • https://www.crazy-factory.com/en-US/p/Body-Jewelry/Labrets/XINLBPJD/Logo-Disc-Labret



  • 35 languages (more coming soon)

  • Complex ERP System

  • Learn something new EVERY day

  • Find and implement strategies for high-volume traffic

  • Extend SEO for organic growth

  • There is a right solution for every problem, we need YOU to find and execute it


Technologies



  • PHP5/7

  • TypeScript

  • HTML5

  • CSS3 (Twitter Bootstrap, OOCSS, BEM)

  • MySQL

  • ElasticSearch

  • JavaScript

  • jQuery

  • js

  • Git

  • C# (ASP.NET Core) 

  • Aurelia for Apps

  • Phalcon for PHP-API

  • Entity framework for C# API

  • Brain – very old technology, everybody is born with it, but not all people can use it effectively


We are promoting



  • Agile development

  • Behavior Driven Development (BDD)/ Test Driven Development (TDD)

  • OOP

  • Scrum

  • Best practices for a high QoC

  • The usage of the best available tools for each problem


We are moving


Not now, but around August 2017 our company will move from Bangkok to Bang Sa-Re. This area is quieter and more rural than bangkok, but none of the less beautiful and a great place to settle down. If you ever wanted to built a house next to a beautiful beach ... THIS is your chance!


Take a look at the area here: https://goo.gl/maps/GNzecd5YaTw


Bangkok is only 90 minutes away from Bang Sa-Re.


And many beautiful islands just moved a lot closer to your work place. Quickly visit Koh Samet or
Koh Chang.


Please feel free to ask us any questions you have about Thailand, Bangkok and Bang Sa-re.

jobs.title: Firmware Engineer
jobs.content:
The Role


You will help develop a high-end touchscreen device that meets international standards as an accurate distance recorder. You’ll be involved in the full lifecycle of development, including defining technical requirements, technical design, task estimation, development, implementation, testing, validation and deployment.


Responsibilities include:



  • Hands-on cutting robust, maintainable and scalable code with tests.

  • Embedded software design and development in C and C++.

  • Unit testing using Googletest and Googlemock.

  • Automated integration and robustness testing with trip simulation.

  • Code inspection and peer review using GitFlow.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer, Informatics
jobs.content:
Abbott is a global healthcare company devoted to improving life through the development of products and technologies that span the breadth of healthcare. With a portfolio of leading, science-based offerings in diagnostics, medical devices, nutritionals and branded generic pharmaceuticals, Abbott serves people in more than 150 countries and employs approximately 73,000 people. Please note that candidates need to be eligible to work in the U.S. without Abbott sponsorship.

JOB DESCRIPTION:

Primary Job Function
* This is a technical role with the candidate expected to be a critical contributor to building compelling informatics products within Abbotts Diagnostics Division.
* The individual will develop software on informatics programs from concept through launch. She/he will also be responsible for supporting on-market products post-launch.
* She/he will be responsible for defining, developing and documenting either presentation tier, application tier, services tier of desktop, mobile or cloud hosted informatics products.

Core Job Responsibilities

Responsible for implementing and maintaining the effectiveness of the quality system.
* The individual will be responsible for design and development of applications using contemporary platform architectures such as SOA (Service Oriented Architectures), Cloud Computing, Big Data, Web, Mobile, other.
* The individual is responsible for executing the various software development lifecycle (SDLC) activities user stories, use cases, software requirements, design, development and design verification (incl. unit, functional and system testing).
* She/he is responsible for developing test plans and test cases for software components.
* The individual is responsible for root cause analysis including troubleshooting of informatics work products during development and for on-market products.
* She/he will be responsible for creating and maintaining documentation for the artifacts created during the SDLC.
* The individual will be responsible for ensuring the continuous improvement and evolution of software work products.
* The individual should independently conceive plans and implement development artifacts (requirements, analysis, design, documentation and software work products) as-needed to meet program goals.
* The individual may travel occasionally per needs of the assigned project.

Position Accountability / Scope
* The individual is responsible for the design, development and commercialization of informatics products in compliance with internal policies and procedures, both US and Foreign regulatory standards and requirements.
* The individual will participate in development efforts using Agile development frameworks such as Scrum or Kanban.
* The individual will interact with project managers and R&D leadership on project scope, timeline, risks and budget.
* She/he is accountable for the development of one or more informatics modules as assigned on individual programs.
* The individual will work as part of cross-functional teams in Global Marketing, Research & Development, Information Technology, Quality, Operations, Regulatory and Business Development to deliver informatics products.
* She/he will work with a broad range of technologists and support personnel both within and outside of Abbott.

Minimum Education

Bachelors degree in one or more following disciplines: Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Software Engineering, Decision Sciences, Symbolic Systems, Informatics, Mathematics, Physics or Information Systems. An advanced degree in one of the above disciplines is preferred.

Minimum Experience / Training Required

Minimum of 5-8 years of experience at a startup, mid- to large-sized...

jobs.title: Senior Developer
jobs.content:
Atlassian helps teams everywhere change the world through the power of software and we are looking for a technical wizard to help Synchrony's development team. Synchrony is the engine behind Confluence's co-editing feature. 


As a Senior Developer, you’ll be crafting and implementing with the team a data synchronisation service for tree data structures using operational transformation on a large scale. All the hard problem of OT with nested tree data, n-squared complexity issue, support of key-value maps and many other challenges are solved in Synchrony. 


We are supported by robust deployment systems, mature algorithmic solutions, and an experienced team with a strong desire to build the best synchronisation technology out there. Think Nasa launching the Rover on Mars or Cochlear gifting children born deaf with the ability to hear, your work directly impacts the products they use to advance humanity. You'll need a strong technical prowess with incredible coding ability across a diverse set of languages and technologies. 


What you do 

  • Solve challenging problem with simple, elegant solutions

  • Deep dive into operational transformation algorithms

  • Possess authority in performance, scalability and service system architecture

  • Work on a leading technology to enable more real-time collaboration across different types of applications


 Basic Qualifications 



  • 5+ years of functional programming experience (Clojure, Haskell, Scala, ...)

  • Experience building scalable, high performance systems that are highly available

  • Strong functional programming fundamentals

  • Ability to rapidly self-train on new technologies

  • Knowledge of web-based applications and architecture

  • Real passion for solving complex problems


Preferred Qualifications

  • Clojure experience

  • Bachelors/Masters degree in Computer Science or a related field

  • Familiarity with eventual consistency systems

  • Experience building on AWS

  • Experience evaluating and adopting new technologies

  • Good communication skills to both technical and non-technical audiences



Atlassian. Powered by you.




We believe that the unique contributions of all Atlassians is the driver of our success. To make sure that our products and culture continue to incorporate everyone's perspectives and experience we never discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, or marital, veteran, or disability status.

jobs.content: You can expect a lively and challenging environment with very interesting problems to solve. We are happy to train and mentor the right people; the important thing is to have a bright mind and the motivation to question, explore and learn.

jobs.title: DevOps Engineer
jobs.content:
Cake are looking for a passionate and skilled Operations Developer (DevOps) with a real passion for on-going learning and continual skills development.  


This role will be based in Cake's global HQ in Houldsworth Mill, Manchester.


The role will involve maintaining and creating Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery pipelines, to ensure the development process is automated and repeatable.  You will be helping to build and deploy system infrastructure in a cloud focused environment while providing operational advice to developers when appropriate.Another responsibility will be monitoring existing clusters of deployed instances in the Cloud maintaining backups and performance (manually scaling where appropriate), identifying errors, troubleshooting, improving alerting on failure and also deploying new code releases to those environments.

jobs.title: Java Backend Engineer
jobs.content:
For our IT department at our headquarters in Pullach close to Munich we are looking for a


Java Backend Engineer (m/f)


hungry for solving technical and business challenges by joining a high performance “full-stack” team. We are building a next generation mobility ecosystem based on cloud-native microservices platform and we want you to be part of our journey and make an impact!




Your job - accelerates as powerfully as our cars:



  • You will build consumer-facing software that “just works” in Java.

  • You will be responsible for designing end-to-end distributed systems on the cloud.

  • You will build libraries and tools for our microservices ecosystem.

  • You will work on event-driven systems and keep yourself up to date with the latest technologies to help you create scalable and resilient software.

  • You will create value through automation throughout the entire application lifecycle.



Your profile - your readiness to go fast:



  • You have experience in a technology sophisticated environment such as building cloud-native applications, solving scalability challenges, designing event-driven solutions - ideally in a startup dynamic setting?

  • You have development experience in at least one object-oriented programming language such as Java?

  • You have extensive experience in Linux?

  • You have already designed distributed systems or you have worked on microservices architectures? 

  • You have good understanding of event-driven platforms, pub-sub and messaging using brokers such as Kafka, NSQ or RabbitMQ?



Chances for career development - change to the fast lane:



  • We give you the chance to expand your technical skills!

  • We provide you with a modern work environment!

  • We offer you to work in a highly professional and international team!

  • We offer you a competitive salary!

And through this work you'll be helping us feed starving children and saving lives!

jobs.title: Product Manager - AI Enabled Product
jobs.content:
Baidu Research, headquartered in Silicon Valley, is looking for an experienced product manager with strong background in consumer or enterprise facing software products and services such as web and mobile apps. Our team's mission is to develop hard AI technologies that enable us to impact hundreds of millions of users. As a product manager at Baidu, you will lead the exploration and definition of new products that leverage the most advanced AI technologies to transform user experience. You will be working with a small team of highly talented designers, developers, researchers, and product managers. You will have the opportunity to develop creative new products that will directly impact hundreds of millions of users.

Our research teams are creating the next generation of deep learning systems and algorithms. Our focus is pursuing the most promising product ideas that maximize the value of the advanced AI technologies the team is developing. As a product manager, you will be responsible for bridging the technology and business needs to develop creative product ideas, formulate product vision, quickly transform ideas into product prototypes, and build and ship new products and services.

Here's what you will do:

  • Take sizable ownership of new products. Creatively explore new product possibilities enabled by advanced AI technologies.

  • Carry out user studies and market research to understand user pain points and the current market landscape. Define new products that will meet market needs.

  • Provide technical, functional, and business expertise with responsibility for product strategy and roadmap.

  • Perform product owner tasks in an agile scrum development process: collaborate with research and back-end teams, guide initiatives through the development life cycle, and bring high quality software product and services to market.

  • Carry out efficient idea exploration and build functional prototypes quickly.

  • Execute sustainable product development phase that needs development and maintenance of usable, robust, and delightful products.

Here's what we'd like to see in you:

Very strong product skills:

  • Strong experience in consumer or enterprise facing products: strong product sense on which features to build for the users and which designs make for a better product.

  • Strong technical and project management skills: solid understanding of the full software application development life cycle; understanding of the implementation complexity of the product; ability to manage project schedules.

  • Strong strategic skills: ability to decide which business areas a product needs to grow in and why; ability to conducting quantitative market research, conduct user studies and other experiments to develop and validate strategic hypotheses.

  • Track record of defining and delivering successful web and/or mobile applications.

  • Strong communication skills; experienced in cross-organization collaboration.

Culture fit:

  • Mission alignment: If you want to use AI to dramatically improve people's lives, we will give you the best platform to accomplish this mission.

  • Self-directed: We work best with people that are driven, motivated, and aspire to greatness. Are you the sort of person that, if you had time on your hands, will independently find interesting and useful things to do?

  • Hungry to learn: We are eager to learn new things at work, but learning is hard work and this is something we hope you want to do.

  • Team orientation: We work in small, fast-moving teams. We don't believe in lone wolves. We watch out for each other, and go after big goals together--as a team.

We are based in Silicon Valley, in Sunnyvale, California.
